LgHmewbWl8nH8nhxa-5ibQ.text: Awesome vibe and decor, even better food. When you sit down, you're served water with lemon, watermelon, mint and raspberries in it. Yum! The food is super fresh tasting! I got the beef pho & you can tell it doesn't have any MSG- it's not salty at all so a bit surprising at first but it's way better!! The owner is super friendly and walks around table to table chatting with customers. She was hugging the regulars and taking time to get to know people. Best part- it's BYOB! I highly recommend this restaurant!

MGkynd-GLbstjLWgpbhv0A.text: Can't recommend this place enough. Justina is a total crack-up, and treats you like family. Going here tonight with some awesome friends. Can't wait!

g5q7L8C40ou7QGGjlIEA0w.text: The pho is Awesome! The owner is Hilarious and very friendly! She does LOVE the F-bomb, which doesn't bother me but might some.

OUDFH93sSx8SjUMIpdJ3PQ.text: If I could give zero stars I would.  Stopped in for lunch. No one in the place (not a single soul), that was probably my first warning. I sat down anyway, on their hard, uncomfortable plastic chairs (seriously, the decor is very cafeteria like), and started to look over the menu. Pho for $10?? It better be some amazingly good pho! So I sat and I sat, waited and waited. The server/owner/manager/whoever that greeted me when I walked in had gone in the back and after waiting 10 minutes I decided to just leave. Give me a break. There is NO ONE in the place. I'm your ONLY customer and you're going to just let me sit there forever? No thanks. Went to my usual go-to for pho at Pho Van and had an awesome lunch.

LwWAzJ_LDwreMJAky5SeAA.text: Wow! What a surprise find... The service is fantastic. The food is fantastic and the place is clean and modern. I loved it. I will definitely be back. They made me feel very welcomed being a lone diner.

qswgA2oxggNPZ8CR2O_DFg.text: wonderful food - hilarious owner - and great decor and ambiance! Well worth the long trek to get there ~ delicious!

M0id1JWT6cHlFFouPkHfcg.text: For those of you who don't Pho-know any better; this is pretentious Pho.  You're paying for the modern orange walls and acrylic chairs.  Stick to Pho Chandler.

47AhpYin7ec6FbEuILdWEg.text: I'm conflicted in writing this review.  There are large varieties of unique menu items to choose from and the few that I've tried are fairly good.  The only complain I have is the owner and hostess who seems to use foul language from time to time.  The last time I was there for lunch, she drop by our table unexpectedly to chat and badmouth one of the customer who was asking too many questions about the menu then not ordered it.  My friend and I didn't know what to said then later left telling each other to scratch this place from our lunch list.

mTFXdD8GomSiNWa3o0WZZw.text: My family went here for dinner and I am 100% sure the staff, especially Justine, was prejudiced against us because we were Vietnamese.  The Pho was mediocre and all the food we ordered were overpriced.  While Justine made her rounds to chat, flirt, and engage all her Caucasian guests, we were ignored and forgotten.  And by "forgotten," I mean, they didn't bring out our food until we reminded them we existed.  Yes, the greens and food were fresh. However, calling this place a Vietnamese restaurant would be comparable to calling Taco Bell a Mexican restaurant.  We didn't care so much about the price as long as the food was good. However, since both the food was sub-par and the service was terrible, this is one place we will not be returning to.

cux5UL51E67nR_XO6azIUQ.text: This is a secret place that some people drive far to go to.  Great environment with colorful lights.  You can bring wine in.  Owner is a server and is great..

N2vlEoGP4OpqQM_bw6-Htg.text: Best phone in town! Always piping hot  made with love and a great menu. Check it out. You will not be disappointed

PNvTbpfs_kt3wiDI9N7JDg.text: A friend turned me on to this place.   The food is top notch.   Justine is a hoot.  If I go too long between visits, I get withdrawls.

gRompG8lkCbo8Yfi8X_bLA.text: I gotta say that if you have never tried Pho, you may think this place is the end all be all. It gets 3 stars from me because of the exposure it has given Viet food in the valley.  there are much better restaurants than Cyclo, with much better value and menus.

ctuECvgajNtaHKd223DYLg.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the Phoenix area, and I've taken several friends here to share it with, both locally and from out of town. In fact, I would like to go there today! I love the Lemongrass chicken, spicy beef salad, Seafood Pho, and the garlic green beans.    I absolutely love the food, and the only reason it doesn't have five stars is the service. It's not terrible and they've never screwed up my order or anything, but it's not the greatest I've ever had. I recall waiting a few minutes with an empty water glass before I could resume eating because I was thirsty. I'd rather wait for a refill than not eat at this restaurant though.  One thing to keep in mind, this place is small, and it gets busy, so if you don't want to wait for a table, go at an off time like during the week or for lunch. Dinner time on Friday or Saturday night fills up pretty quick!

w8kTAsqGt7LcMVSm_LeAcQ.text: First, they don't answer their phone. Next, they are closed between lunch and dinner. Finally, it is ridiculously OVER PRICED for the area and quality. $43?! I literally pay $24 for the exact same order at another pho spot very close. I'm not opposed to paying out the nose for great food, but it better be just that. And it isn't.

Li-Fow7Tyo3IlKEl-hXaCA.text: I was told tonight that every person from Vietnam has a story.  Justina's is all about personalized service, oh, and a rough journey from North Vietnam to Los Angeles, by way of Hong Kong.  Some people may not like her or her style.  I thought she was funny and worked hard to live up to her claim that her food has a secret ingredient, love.  I tasted another ingredient, fun.  I'm not Vietnamese, but I have a story about tonight.  I met a good friend of mine while here on business who had worked with a lady in Tucson who recommended her cousin Justina's restaurant in Phoenix.  When we told our server of this recommendation, the menu was snatched away and we were given "owner's choice".  Not bad.  The Green Papaya salad was excellent, the heat tempered nicely with the Thai Iced Tea.   The shrimp on the side of the salad was also very tasty.  The Pork Short Ribs were next.  They were very tender with a subtle BBQ sauce, slightly sweet and all good.  A beef or pork (not sure) and rice dish came next and it was also very good.  The meat was tender and again, subtly spiced.  Not hot though.  The main dish, a mix of vegetables, scallop, shrimp and beef was less impressive.    Finally, the dessert (not something I usually do) was excellent.  As another reviewer pointed out, they are a little known sensation.  I had the creme brulee (jasmine? not sure, but very, very good) and the mango with sticky rice (covered with coconut milk).  The Vietnamese coffee was also very good.  It is allowed to drip at the table, mixed with the sweetened cream in the bottom of the glass, then poured over ice.  It's strong and full of flavor.  I may be up all night.  Oh, and as for price, this all came in at $58 for both of us.  I don't know if this is reasonable, high or cheap.  It ain't bad in general.  Those of you who do Vietnamese often will have make the call.  I'm not in Phoenix often, but I will return to try some of the other menu items (Pho and other noodles for sure).

VThdbaTIkgqEJDDNS1ghsw.text: There are not many Vietnamese places around so I go here on rare occasion when I feel like eating something different... and spending a lot of money... yes really - it is overpriced IMO  It would get another star or even two if the prices were more reasonable. They do well so I'm sure they are not going to change the prices.  Food: quality and flavor is good.  Service: I've never has good service here. It is average, at best.  Overall: unless I'm going out on business (and the company is picking up the tab) and the person says take me somewhere close by that is "different" I usually skip this place and spend the same $ on better places.

aIx4oGPsMoCgLMJ9S-YWRg.text: Your gonna love it or hate it.  This place is somewhat unique spurred on my owner Justine.  She is Sassy for sure and she reminds me somewhat of the soup Nazi.  She will pick on you, insult you, hit on you, and more in the same evening.  You will either enjoy this or feel uncomfortable.    The food is good and some of my favorites are the green papaya salad, Pad Thai, and Suon Non.    Bring a six pack of a nice Asian beer if you are going because it is BYOB.  You may or may not get your left overs back  :)  The service needs work for sure but I have not found it as bad as many reference in their reviews.  I guess when you have a beer in your hand it is easier to wait or tolerate.   Enjoy!

bQkiC5b_15NaLfOPa9T2CQ.text: This place is great! Excellent pho with a very trendy vibe. Also good to note that this place is byob

W1vQG1m1YXvY2dYp2u8Y2A.text: I love love love this place!!  The pho broth is made with OX tail and you can tell. The garlic green beans ROCK!

48i_xiiv2dU6_jup8NW3_w.text: Not normally the one to chose Vietnamese food if I have options but wow blown away by this restaurant. Owner is a character, lots of personality and will keep you entertained without being over-bearing. Food is scrumptious! Have tried several dishes all delicious, my favorite being the vermicelli cake loaded with fresh veggies! Yum! Also owner makes her own kombucha and she will bring little samples in the cutest glasses inside of a book, hard to describe but cutest presentation. Must try!

64ifx_HN3kCcNW2FiV_XYw.text: The restaurant has a modern flair and is pretty neat inside. Different atmosphere than most Vietnamese restaurants. I LOVE Pho, so I ordered that during my visit. It was good. Broth was flavorful. However, I'm used to tripe and the meatballs being an option at every Vietnamese restaurant I have been to. Sadly, I did not see that option on the menu. Maybe I missed it, but I scanned that menu like a detective looking for clues and didn't see it. That aside, the owner is a whole different story. This woman was one of the FUNNIEST people I've ever met. If she set up a microphone in her restaurant and did stand up, I would be in the front row. She was very attentive and made sure we were happy. We will be back and maybe I'll stray from my usual to try other options on that menu. I do think people should go to at least have a conversation with the owner over their beautiful pomegranate and lemongrass water.

XOTvSsXtjvPqY4N2ByopMQ.text: Modern little place, very clean, fresh flowers on every table...the food was super fresh with good flavor! Beautiful presentation of the food- even the water was beautiful with fresh fruit in it!

JNd01_GX6Prp2xVYKJxUTQ.text: This place is absolutely wonderful! The people are so lovely too! The meal was so delicious and they are willing to alter some of the menu too. We wanted the meat and chicken soups but with veggies and they were happy to make that adjustment for us. There is no doubt we will be back! Such a great experience!

b0O2JxN_Pxv4N0DpMeA03g.text: This was my first time coming to Cyclo, and I have to say, it's a Chandler gem!   It's locally owned, and the owner is what makes the place worth going to. She puts her passion for healthy living into her restaurant, and she is quick to start a genuine conversation with you. The food makes a place good, but the atmosphere and people make a place great-- and this place is great.  The water is served with seasonal fruit inside of it, which leads you to drink more than you usually would-- which is a plus! The food was delicious, we got Pho Ga and the egg rolls. I definitely recommend checking Cyclo out if you're in the neighborhood.

DZWlbGADvbjjduzqvYbXVg.text: I went to this place when I went to Arizona, and I'm from California. This was a very nice restaurant and had nice decorations inside, additionally it was clean! The broth was really good and didn't taste full of MSG like other Vietnamese restaurants. I just got the beef combo pho and enjoyed it, especially after a long day of traveling on the road. Definitely a place to try if you're craving Vietnamese food and you're around the area!!

2MHtGA87U-_BouXsdNuA5A.text: Absolutely delicious!  Great friendly service. They adjusted the Pho for us and it was perfect. Super cute atmosphere too.

2QXebfAdjw6YM6dxVvbx6A.text: Well, I just had the best bowl of chicken pho I've ever had. My husband had the fried rice, which was also bomb. This place is clean and adorned with fresh flowers. rTUMgnqCc827iwMtP-5gjQ.text: First time trying Cyclo. Great food the food is fresh and yummy. The owner is a riot. Good for lunch and dinner.

NWofBBStdYvA3YAanctbDw.text: Yes Justina is a foul mouth smart Alec and I wouldn't bring any kids in here but she is also warm and welcoming. She remembers patrons and what they like. Yes the food is expensive - especially for lunch, but the food is great, full of flavor and portions are large - I always take 1/2 my vermicelli home. Plan on $20 per person.  Yes the service can be a little slow but the BYOB policy and casual atmosphere make up for that (although, the chairs are a little uncomfortable). One time we didn't realize they close for a couple hours in the afternoon and walked in for a special celebration just a couple minutes before they closed, they put our beer and wine in the fridge served us and told us to take our time...they are good to their customers.  Check it out but be prepared for what it is.  Also, it's small and gets packed!

iNhHOS0lko0REqoGy-z8rQ.text: We went to eat at Cyclo on the recommendation of a close friend.  The atmosphere is fun and festive.  I'm always game for a place that serves tasty Asian food and does not feel like a cafeteria.  On the contrary, the restaurant is chic.  The food is reasonably authentic, and I mean that in a good way.  Authentic enough that I got my VN fix.  The nuoc mam is flavorful without being overpowering.  The seasoning of the food is well done.  The feel of the dishes is authentic with a little bit of fusion.  Little Dining Partner had the pho tai and really enjoyed it.  Dining partner and I had maybe six of the small plate items (salad/goi, pepper shrimps on toasts, spring rolls/chai gio, etc etc); everything was tasty.  We enjoyed the watermelon slices in the water.  We also loved that it was BYOB.  We're coming back to Phoenix for the holidays.  I'm certain we will be coming to Cyclo again.

iF5hA-ZCDMwGoNShzMqpPA.text: Always a great meal and an awesome time when we go here, and you cannot beat BYOB!  So many fun memories coming to this place with friends

H7dikizXZxl8BYYATXSyDg.text: I have seen this place for Quiet sometime , so mad at myself For waiting this long. The staff has great personalities and the time wait for my lunch was very fast . High in flavor and a killer value . Defiantly a must try !

q7thcLZ1y7wuV2PWnbQ5gg.text: The food is superb... Hands down, the best Vietnamese food I've ever had in the west. Justina is great too.. Such a character... Don't piss her off though or she'll make you feel about 2 inches tall... Not that I know from personal experience ;)

hVGt_DJIF3_JQtK3fYGDOg.text: We love the restaurant for its food and atmosphere. Justina, the owner, has a unique style and she might come across a bit too eccentric and offensive for some people. That's her personality and it is part of what you get at cyclo. We go there once a month and find the food to be consistently good. One thing we'd like to see some new dishes once in a while. Our kids love the rolls and lemongrass chicken - sure bet. They have internet access, good for me if I have to do emails. Decor is great however I am not fond of the patio chairs. We can bring our own wine at no extra charge, which is a plus. The music is Ok, ambience and at least it doesn't hit you on the head like brick - like sushi room or postino. Cleanliness Ok. I know they once had issues with inspectors finding dead roaches - but we're giving them a chance. Service - when Justina isn't there is lacking. The waiter walks around with his iPod and not really paying attention. I've never seen this in my entire life. This is a big negative. Overall, we find this to be a superior Vietnamese restaurant compared to others in the Phoenix area. Most are downright awful so the bar isn't that high. In the end, they do score some points.

I_08VaywBEtbrewTovuQdw.text: First of all it's $14.50 for a bowl of pho' . that's way over price.  The soup was disgustingly bland and the one of the owners was walking around like a vietnamese hitler runway model, pacing back and for in the restaurant.  The interior decor was dark and reminded me second hand IKEA store.  I would never come back here and if you're smart take your business elsewhere.  You been warned.

ekA2VK91aYxsPMvrLULxmQ.text: Wow, what a mixed bag of reviews.  Seems to me that some folks happen to go to Cyclo when their low mental cycles coincide with low points for the restaurant and others manage to coincide their highs.  Either that or too many cranky people are going to a great place.  That said, we just got back from meeting out of town relatives at Cyclo, which has become a tradition.  Don't understand the complaints about the decor or the service.  I do understand the differences in reactions to the food since in our party of five, there were definite differences.  The pork chop and the crispy noodle cake were thumbs down, with the verdict rendered on the noodles because it was impossible to tell apart the different types of protein that were supposed to be served with it.  Two had the mint chicken which was given an OK, although the broken rice was a bit plain for both eaters' tastes.  I had the Hanoi vermicelli and it was to die for.  Incredible broth, perfectly grilled meat, great herb accompaniment.  So folks, it all boils down (pardon the pun) to what you order.  By the way, heard no f-bombs from the owner who was her delightfully sassy self as well as being an efficient server and a really snazzy dresser.  Friday night and the place was at capacity.  Still on my list of places to go back to, even if all too infrequently.  BTW, all those complaints about the pricing were just silly.  It's not 1952 any more.

bPHdj2Ot1DBQ_3JQajsMwQ.text: I had the chance to have dinner at Cyclo Chandler this week.  I absolutely loved it!  I am in the service business and appreciated the personal service.  The owner who I am told is there all of the time was so warm and friendly and funny!  I know for most it is only important if the food is good but the way I am treated in a restaurant and the ambience is also important.  I am american and vietnamese is new to me.  I am still learning how to figure out what everything is on the menu.  I had a dish of beef, shrimp and scallops with veggies over a fried noodle patty.  I forgot what it is called!  It sounded strange to me but was amazing!  I did not care for the black pepper shrimp appetizer too much but cannot wait to dine her again!  It was a great experience:)

qG36Ad23DenT9lS81h11yA.text: I'm sold on Cyclo. I'm a fan of the owner, Justina, who kept us entertained throughout the evening with her zany extroverted personality. At one point she spotted my date struggling with the pho (combined with my unmanly failure to assist her, since I'm pretty incompetent with pho myself), and jumped in to give her a little hands-on tutorial on how to combine the spoon with the chopsticks to scoop out the crab meat from the legs, swirl up the noodles and slurp it all up. By the way, we did request forks on no less than 3 separate occasions. They were promised but never came. All is forgiven because of the tutorial, though. Not to mention the food was tasty (we shared two dishes: the seafood pho and the Bun Bo Xao) and the ambiance was as cozy and charming as one would hope for a nice little date night. We brought our own wine, which the server chilled for us in their fridge. A pleasant experience throughout.

5Gp_APfLBMn71oB7HW6aCw.text: Best banh xeo in town!! The spicy beef salad fantastic, first time I had a dish deemed spicy that actually was. Perfect if you spicy food!! As for the pho here, it's not all that, they use too much anise. The banh xeo and beef salad are the only dishes I liked and will return to have again. If you want great pho, spring rolls, rice/noodle dishes go to pho nhat on southern in mesa you won't be disappointed.

TYtTS7M29lDzl0r5qp5Hgg.text: Let me preface by sharing that I am a Vietnamese who have eaten Vietnamese food on five continents the past 15 months and I have to crown Cyclo as a gem!  Who would have guess it would be in Chandler, AZ?  For the quality and the price, you cannot beat it. I noticed a reviewer noted the price was higher than expected, but I sense the reviewer is not familiar with the finer details of the dishes which foodies won't mind paying for at a restaurant.  For example, you can order a bowl of pho at any VN restaurant, but they often only give you basil instead of the other fragrant herbs that should accompany a bowl of pho.   At Cyclo, they don't cut corners so the dishes come out complete with the love and attention as if you are family. I have to admit, my favorite dish there is the crepe. It's perfectly prepared so that the edges are crispy and the crepe itself is not doughy. But what separate it from other crepes is that Cyclo correctly includes all the fresh herbs that should accompany this dish. Most restaurants just give you some cilantro and lettuce to go with the crepe, but Cyclo gives you the complete experience!  It's analogous to eating mushroom risotto at an Italian restaurant with a shaving of aromatic truffle vs just a shake of pepper on top.  It's all in the details!  I enjoy the food so much I have been stopping by there for dinner when ever I am in town on business. My friends can't believe it because I generally tend to prefer restaurants with a 10 course tasting menu where I can linger for 2-3 hours each night enjoying my dinner.  The quality of the food at Cyclo must be good or I wouldn't be wasting my time there.  Besides, if you are trying to get the best bang for your dollar, this is definitely the place to eat.  The quality exceeds the price here.  I am trying to make my way down the menu and so far I have not been disappointed.  But my favorites are the crepes, the short rib appetizer, goi cuon (summer rolls), lemongrass chicken, and stir-fried string beans. The latter is full of flavor and your taste buds will appreciate it.   Generally, I don't order desserts at Vietnamese restaurants, but I always finish my dinner here with one of the house made desserts.  Creme Brulee was the correct texture which is important to me.  I typically won't order tapioca dessert because I think they are boring, but I was making my way down the menu so I took their suggestion and ordered it last time.  I am happy to report the tapioca dessert here was a few notches above the usual tapioca dessert so I will order it again next time. When in season, you can also order mango and sticky rice for dessert.  Yes, I have tried them all and can vouch for them.  Oh, one warning though: the at-your-table drip-coffee is very addictive and very strong.  It really rounds out the meal nicely but you will be up for a while with that boost of caffeine!  Incidentally, the best part of Cyclo is not just the food, but the warm service with a smile.  All must come together to create the perfect meal!  Cyclo is now a gem in my back-pocket.  I look forward to my next business trip to AZ so I can stop by again!

QEvRdvca5UBd_4YewL7Dwg.text: Tried Cyclo about four times.  I really liked it the first couple times.  But this last time I went, I brought a friend along who had never tried it.  I was kind of embarrassed by the service.  The food is consistently good as is the lemonade.  Their new decor is nice also.  But they really fell flat on their face with their service.  It seems like the waitress only takes the food orders, one of the cooks brought out the food so of course he don't know who gets what, they brought mine first, then a few minutes later my boyfriend got his and then our friend got her food.  When we finished eating we had half of our food left over that we were going to take home.  We asked her for boxes and she proceeded to stack all our plates on top of each other.  She brought our check and my boyfriend told her that we wanted to take our food home and she says "sorry, I didn't hear you" and left it at that.  We were disappointed and won't be back which is a shame.

dtn5M7NuJhMW6NHqyOOdWA.text: don't like, i ask for spicy not a jar of red chili pepper.  one person wating on 20 tables. you think about how quick you get serve.

EahSFan3Nw4HTP0cn5DI-A.text: Decided to try this place after reading all the rave reviews and hoopla. It is completely "overrated". Had the Chicken Noodle pho and although tasty, never really figured out what the fuss is all about. I believe you can get that same style pho (that tastes as good) in other Vietnamese restaurants across the valley. Prices aren't cheap either. Maybe I'm biased due to the fact that I had to wait for about 90 minutes (yes, you read correct - an hour and half) before I was seated. This place probably seats about 30 people max so that doesn't help either. Also noticed that this is a BYOB(eer)/W(ine) establishment. One positive thing that I noted was that the owner (figured her name is Justina after reading a few reviews here) was extremely friendly and interacted with all the customers making them feel very welcome. Rare to find such service these days. Would definitely not go back for the food, but might consider going back for the friendly service.

bAhW5fdnsRqpjFJ2Oop5fw.text: My wife and I just had lunch today at Cyclo on a recommendation from one of the best restaurants in Chandler.  It is a small restaurant right next to the wall greens.  A perfect example of don't judge a book by its cover.  We got there about 1:30 and place was surprisingly busy for a late lunch.  We were immediately greeted by Justina, which is either the owner or manager, either way very friendly.  I ordered the pad thai and my wife ordered the mint chicken.  The food was incredible.  Best of all Justina came by to check on us and informed us that they allow you to BYOB!  As soon as we got in our car she was on the phone with some friends of ours planning our next trip back.

SbQa2CXPv5xnzLLsEWrY6Q.text: I've been to Cyclo twice. The first time was great. The food and service was really good. Pretty reasonably priced. Really loved the fact that you could bring your own wine. Went back about a year later. Again, food was great. The garlic green beans as good as I remember. Pretty good service. The owner was there again in another cute little dress (sorry, but I notice that kind of shit). Liked the check holders had customer graffiti all over them (more dumb shit I notice). Finished the wine and meal, hit up the bathroom before leaving. Only one and it was occupied. Fine, it's a small place I understand. Wait a bit, then our spiky haired waiter comes out. He gives me a shifty look, which I didn't understand. I Immediately get it once I make my way in and look at the toilet. Didn't even put the seat up. Piss everywhere. I was so mad. Unfortunately, the bill was paid and he was tipped by the time I came out. F'n disgusting. I hate to judge the place by one waiter, but feel like if they are gonna let this ahole work here, can't help but think what else they might be letting slide.   Sorry, won't be back.

t4IBp_Za_jHqrY6qXjbFtg.text: Very good. Cheap.  Too bad it is located in the seventh dimension of hell (aka Chandler).  I would eat here every week if it wasn't.

at12Oau_qy8xrJAhqBUJaw.text: I love Cyclo.  We've been many times and its usually VERY busy.  Excellent Vietnamese food! Every dish we've had here has been great!!  Despite the poor reviews of the Pho, every one we've had has been good, especially the seafood Pho. The owner is so nice and friendly!  Its BYOB too!  If you like Vietnamese food, check it out!!!

QsDt6pvuGaEOJvASOJ593A.text: I love Justina, the owner.  She is super sweet, funny and sassy.  It's True that she has a wicked sense of style!  My husband and I had our second date here and religiously go about once a month.  We go for the AWESOME food - the Mint Chicken is my favorite although the Crispy Noodle Cake is pretty good too.  My husband also likes the Pad Thai here.  You can't beat the BYOB or BYOW with no corking fee.  I love the atmosphere, the music and how intimate the restaurant is.  This really is one of my favorite places to eat and I always bring out of town guests here.  :)

NYaPkuDcaBPNf5qJqvKxGQ.text: I was having a frustrating day at work and couldn't care less about getting back to work late from lunch.  Pho had been on my mind heavily at that time, and I decided to indulge.  I read up on some places in Chandler, and this was the closest one to the job. This was a while back, but from what I can remember, the pho was good-not the best-but good.  They gave me all the fixins, the broth was just right, meat was tender, and the noodles were cooked just so.   The service was...interesting.  I won't say its bad, its just very non-chalant.  Kinda breezy.  I'll leave it at that.  And since service is so important to me, I had to give the place 3 stars.   The decor and actual building don't garner a comment from me.  I couldn't see anything anyway after the steam from my pho clouded my glasses up.   What can I say?  I went there for pho and got satisfied.  Not the best I had, but it hit the spot.  The menu looked like it had some awesome stuff on it though, however the prices aren't the greatest.  Honestly, I should try this place again and review it afterwards.  One visit won't give you the full flavor of any place, and this one seems like it has more to offer than what I required from it. Give it a try.

jTupN37y8Gv5zVvYSDNnnQ.text: I had the pho and my friend had the vermicelli with grilled meat and egg rolls.  Both dishes were tasty.  The decor was cute but very dark for dinner.  The owner is very flamboyant.  One coworker loves this place.  He also says he was kicked in the head by the owner with her 5 inch heels and she threw trash at him.  Another coworker believes she is so rude that he will never go back.  I think the consensus between most of them is that the food is good and the owner gives a good performance. My friend and I did not receive a special performance but she does dress to impress in small tropical outfits.

GNErXnCF-jvryxl6S_HNcA.text: Didn't care for it.  Expensive, small portions, and mediocre cooking.  Go a few blocks west to Saigon Pho if you want the real thing.  But this place is prettier, whatever that's worth to you.

atK75-QbNwH51xTR1E0_Kg.text: Its BYOB. The owner is hilarious. The food is really good. The service is interesting but not bad. It is what it is. Its not fine dining and your not paying fine dining prices so relax. It kinda ads to the charm for me. Good times...

TYx2Ftc_2uhqwqfifMBe4w.text: My wife and I eat out 3-4 times a week.  We have a hard time finding restaurants that consistently serve great food and have even better service.  Cyclo has both, and Justina makes dining an absolute pleasure.  We have been dining at Cyclo for 3 years and it is definitely one of my top five restaurants in the Phoenix metro area. Cyclo does not serve alcohol but has a BYOB policy that makes going out to dinner a whole lot less expensive.  I highly suggest eating here as it is one of the better restaurants that I have experienced.

kbaalkOVI6fSDDGG5Qemsw.text: Eh, it was okay but overpriced.  The food was passable.  The service was bad.  I saw her smiling and being friendly with others, just not us.  Maybe she is relying on being cute to make up for her lack of manners.  She would not give my fellow diner a fork, the bus boy heard the request denied and gave him one.  He was a tad miffed, and I was outright pissed.  But hey, it's her restaurant, if she wants to be a jerk about it, then I'll go elsewhere.  And I will.  To seal the deal, I read their Maricopa County Health Services report, GROSS.  Cyclo, you're dead to me.

Yz3emcEuV9bKFXMg0iGPCA.text: Went last night, awesome environment, great art, amazing food if you like Vietnamese, would recommend the seafood soup and the egg rolls. BYOB which I love!

rXz4405D7jRuwT1sp61OIA.text: This is not your regular DIVEY Vietnamese joint.  If I want that I'll go to Da VANG, where truth be told I'm afraid to go to their bathroom, but enough about that.  Cyclo has the best seafood crab soup! The spicy green beans are amazing and yes Justina is half the reason to go.  The prices are higher but the quality is BETTER.  There are so many things on this menu that I love.... the cake noodles are the BEST!

pIE-2I1771My-O6i9yv3gA.text: I took some of my Intel boyfriends (LOL, I see you on Yelp!) here twice at the recommendation of a friend.  The first time they were closed for renovations, and finally got back there last week.  The "Thai Iced Tea" wasn't very good - it wasn't thick enough, even a little better.  I had the Pho Hai San.  It was good but not very much seafood - but not bad for $10.  My co-worker got the Com Tam - which was good.  A couple others got various Phos, they're Vietnamese pros and I'd say on average we probably would give this place a 6 (1-10).  The owner had a tongue in cheek way about her, was funny at times but went a little too far at others.  Anyway - been meaning to write this review for a while now, but the buzz around the office this morning is about a recent health inspection.  We figured it was BEFORE the renovation, but it was AFTER!  Its really disgusting, and none of us will ever eat there again.  We're talking some serious stuff.  Food being stored in a broken fridge, and unsightly critters running over the FOOOD!!!!    I gave it a 2 because w/o the bugs I probably would give it a 3-4, maybe a 4 because of the low prices.  Maybe I'm naive and critters are in all restaurants but now that I've seen the report - no thanks.

sIWDjDddQxnKDhJcPE9teA.text: it's good, very good, but for a Vietnamese place, has a very short menu with limited choices.    And for the biggest knock on the place, no fish sauce on the table.  Huh?  Well, judging from the lunch crowd, none of the people that eat there would know what it is anyway.  Not a Nguyen in the place other than the people running it.  (joke for those of you with Smith for last name!)  No big deal.  Pho Tai was very good, I love having green onions in the soup, but I doubt it is traditional.  The accessory bowl was short a few green items but all very fresh.  The broth very nice, though I think salty, but mmm, good.  Service was excellent.  Ambience different than I expected.  Small, quaint, clean, lots of awards on the wall, which I'm sure are well deserved.    The spring rolls were very tasty, though not traditional with dried pork, but the crispy and very yummy grilled pork and shrimp were delicious with the right hint of mint.  mmmm.  Very good peanut sauce to go with it, though I'm a fish sauce fan, which I didn't get to try THIS time.  Next time I will.  I also tried the preserved lemon soda.  Delicious!  I think if this place was close by, I'd eat here a lot.  A nice Pho can't be beat and I would love to give their other menu items a chance.

4k5ZUcXq2ROpNk7HJC11dA.text: I saw the reviews and wanted to try this place. I found it to be rather average for beef Pho. The only negative was the side of bean sprouts that came with it were a little old and wilted on the ends. I did like the place but I don't think it is above average. I don't drink wine with my Pho so maybe that is a plus if you do. The people are friendly and the service was good. The Thai Iced tea was good too.

XA1f93rdDEgmYYcy7VzBbQ.text: I was at a wine tasting recently with a group of friends and we began to talk about Vietnamese food. Someone swore that this was absolutely the best in the valley so I had to try it. Suffice to say I was disappointed. I ordered the seafood pho and while it was okay it definitely lacked flavor. I will admit that the black pepper shrimp was delicious but everything else we had was subpar and much more expensive than any other Vietnamese spot I have been to...I'm going back to Pho Van.

cBEblFdPZiCteHkkHKgxCw.text: I left my previous review after my first time at Cyclo, which was an awesome experience.  Since then, I've been back a couple of times, and each time both the food and the service seem to get a little bit worse.  At this point Cyclo is nothing special, and Anise and Pho Van up the street are probably both better.  Additionally, I read that Cyclo nearly got shut down during their last health inspection for some major violations, so that makes me a bit hesitant to ever return.

sKZ4_hF1X8tYqkbOulssrA.text: Very cute place, in a strip mall, oh well, it is Phoenix.  They papaya salad, awesome!

DbqLmYn3-zKb4BwE72m1Cw.text: Use to really brag about Cyclo.... don't know if the economy got the better of the business, or the owner is just gotten complacent, but I no longer go, or recommend it.  The portions have gotten smaller, and the quality has gone down hill.  One bright note... the owner is still funny, and sarcastic, which I love.  Get your act together, and put the shine back on your gem!!!!

wovZbw2i1fYRwf6rNvZt0g.text: Food was very fresh, service was quick and the owner is super personable and lively! Ordered freshy rolls, chicken pho and pad tai, all were great! Water has blood orange, lime and lemongrass, very refreshing!

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pad Thai
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Freshy rolls were super fresh and yummy, served with peanut sauce.
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Water is colorful and tasty!

TQH6NKTDnJi-m7hFrfO17g.text: Love the atmosphere in this place.  The owner is very friendly and loves to talk to you.  Food is great, and the bring your own liquor is even better!  Well definetly be back.

uNxL3dV15O9e8aJrGGA7tA.text: Seafood Pho and egg rolls were delicious. Loved the fruit infused water even. Owner was super friendly and helpful. I will definitely be back!

wG7YF9S5y7rWCgxbChG-Ig.text: I was a Cyclo fan when it first opened and I have been coming back ever since. I have watched Justina turn this place into a quaint shop with just a few plastic tables to the chic modern look that it is today. The quality of the food has not dropped a single notch over the years, and I cannot get enough of the Lat Na! Her pho and lemongrass chicken are also delightful.  One of my favorite parts about Cyclo is that it's BYOB. Bring your own wine, she'll cork it and serve it up to you. Want to keep a second white cold while you wait for entrees? No problem, she'll put it in the fridge for you.  Yes, Justina is a bit of a firecracker with the mouth of a sailor. But you have to appreciate that she doesn't hide who she is, she'll remember your name (especially if you had the audacity to ask for a fork), and she will greet you with a smile when you come back again! Cheers to many more years Justina!

ofWBsjH5mf6QxJM_Wv-axw.text: The best PHO you can get!  This is truly a GEM! Everything on the menu is fantastic...the service is great! The owner is the coolest person you will ever meet!  Probably not the first thing you would discuss on yelp but the water they serve is something you will remember...something different and fresh every time you are there!

UQB_4o3HdFhwKqkLURItsw.text: I love the pho here! I got mine Togo and it was nice to see I wasn't shorted! Will def go back.

y2xZ1pJUKMVlwXl_HOJaqA.text: My friend took me here for the first time last night and I couldn't be more upset that he hasn't showed me this place before. Young man helping us was incredibly attentive, owner was so sweet and has a certain ora to her that can energize your entire body. The pho tai had a nice homemade broth and the you can immediately notice the beef is high quality. I can't wait to come back and I wish you guys would open a location in north Phoenix! We need a good viet spot up there!! Hint hint!!

CJ8GbcRBeW-YAXAYXosrCQ.text: Love this little place with modern clean decor.  Pho was excellent!  The mango rice dessert is my favorite finish to my meals.

bnfFzPf_C1BM4L_d77Q_jA.text: This place is super cute!   It is def different from other pho places, I am used to like the hole-in the wall sketchy looking places but this place was very polished. The water came with cute cut out fruit pieces and I ordered bun and it all came separate in a style that I never had before. The presentation and the quality was amazing but honestly it was a little pricey. Again because I am used to the hole-in-the-wall and so its typically cheaper (~ $6) but here it was around double (~$11).   I would def still go back because it was delicious and the quality of food was excellent.

598vIbvRKjnKdY7V2SPkCw.text: Awesome setting, great owner, broth is best in AZ!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! XL pho. BYOW sounds good to me

U0hNonr1QosvEHsF2UYyqA.text: I am not Vietnamese, but this food rocks, this place rocks, and the staff rocks.  First off the food is awesome. I don't know what authentic Vietnamese food tastes like, but as far as I'm concerned, if this isn't authentic, then I don't want authentic. Fresh ingredients, good spices, and fun options.  Secondly, the atmosphere in here is modern and really fun.  Apparently a Cyclo is a type of Vietnamese bike-cart type thing piloted by skeletons, and they're all over the place, along with cool modern art.  Lastly and most importantly, the staff is really fun. When we came in, the lady who seated us and took our order (I think she's the owner) harassed us for taking too long to order, and then started hitting on one of my associates because he was from Utah and thus probably a polygamist to her. It was super fun.  I've been back only once since, but I can't wait to go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. The garnish in the water is insane!

rMGAj9sGu0l2cgnoRzjEXA.text: I don't have much to say for the interior of restaurant nor the ambiance since this was my first visit. I made an order for carryout, which was ready even earlier than they said it would be, which they quoted at 10 minutes to me over the phone. I ordered the chicken and pineapple curry, as it sounded good. The curry was hardly flavorful at best and was overloaded with spices, like it wasn't made fresh that same day. I should have put the curry down right away but as I was hungry, I finished it. I proceeded to spend the next 2 days with the full symptoms of food posioning, missing 2 days of work because of it. Most expensive, foul bowl of curry I've ever had. Never going back here again.

k_xgnF7ssSQMuMX12X1Yfg.text: This place was recommended by a friend. Thought the pricing was a little high for what we got but the flavor was good. The lady who took care of us was very friendly and helpful. Loved their fruit water!!

rH6vUYJ_GAeUk8771Ys9VQ.text: CYCLO is life changing! I have recently been introduced to it I'm hooked. I love it here... Good for the soul and the appetite. BYOB is one of many great things here. Please experience it with an open mind and you'll find a new favorite place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States

ULjs8MNoHznMPIybJVTyUw.text: I think the best part of this place is the service. The food came out really fast, and for a lunch time place I really enjoy that when I'm on the run. Just the conversation was fantastic, the manager is simply the funniest (and sweetest) woman who calls everyone "love" or "dear" and lets you sit wherever you would like. I will say its a bit pricier than being in Mesa, but the convenience of being closer to my house is such a plus that I can't knock them down anymore than one star!

OBkwI49bS9mJ1xNBHNKzPA.text: I love this place!  The funky/modern decor is perfect. The fruit infused water is delicious. The fresh ingredients are delicious. Staff is efficient, helpful and polite. This is my favorite lunchtime Vietnamese restaurant in town. I highly recommend the the beef soup.

CrTdiL9YqGPrLQNb5ksCdg.text: Justina's hilarious and the water is amazing. They generally infuse it with fresh watermelon, cucumber, and other fruit/veggies. I've had Pho and Bun Bo Xao (she calls it Bun Sai Gon) and both were excellent. Just walk in and say "Hey, how the f**k are ya" and I promise she will respond well.

1wq4hxDNpEzFZeNGmASwGQ.text: Always consistent and great food. I brought my Asian friend you any thought it was awesome. In the hostesses the most us, of course. I'm coming back soon

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Hostess at Cyclo !!!

xsKSKjeUcf2Pf2GQ1A-2Tg.text: This has quickly become one of our favorite restaurants! Our kids love the Pho soup (which they are happy to customize-ex:they take one order of the pho soup and split it between the 2 kids because the portions are too big for them). I love the pad Thai (can't order anything else, it's too good) and my husband has yet to find something he doesn't like (he is more experimental than me)! The service is great, and the water infused with fruit is a nice touch. It's a small place, but we've never had trouble getting a table.

2UdqhgWjKdm7NeP3l0ZWnQ.text: Justina is such a good friend. She always makes me laugh and makes good conversation. The place can get really crowded for lunch but the service is quick. I have never been for dinner.  The chicken wings, spicy ribs, and pho are super good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Empty plates!

myJOAcq0QkXf9viDyedwlg.text: My boyfriend and I love trying new restaurants and especially something that is far from classic American cuisine.  The first time coming into Cyclo, we were hooked.  Justina is there every time that we come to eat and she makes sure to go to each table to either take the order personally or just chat with the table and make sure every one is happy.  I recommend going and letting her "surprise you".  We have yet to actually order, everytime we go she picks our meal and I have yet to have the same thing twice.  Everything is AMAZING.  Absolutely Mouth watering.  Cyclo is BYOB so be sure to bring your favorite wine or beer and enjoy the best vietnamese cusine you have ever tasted! All the staff is attentive and friendly , the artwork is local and beautiful and the feel of the space is inviting, friendly and just happy.  I give it 10 stars!

R-NogjLAVWrvhgPKbhLRKQ.text: If I could separate my review into two categories -- "Food" & "Service" -- the Food would probably rack up a couple more stars. It was good, no complaints at all. Not the best I've ever had, but very nice. Pricey? Yeah, a little ... but probably in the vein of "you get what you pay for"...   For me, the (unfortunate) star of my visit was the service. I can't complain about the promptness or the attentiveness - both were excellent (though I was only 1 of 2 in the restaurant for a rather late lunch that day). What I will complain about -- and what came THAT close to me simply walking out of the restaurant mid-meal -- was the over-the-top, offensive, completely-inappropriate, 4-letter-word-laced commentary by the owner that permeated my entire meal.   I see from other postings that the owner (Justine) seems to be a hugely-positive attraction for many other reviewers. Perhaps I got her on a bad day, or in the middle of an afternoon booze session, or perhaps my experience was especially noticeable due to being one of the only people in the restaurant? Regardless, I was certainly not impressed. It wasn't cute, sexy, or engaging. It certainly wasn't professional. I am not a prude by any means ... but I heard enough F-bombs, bigoted statements, hateful talk, and borderline racist comments during my 45 minutes there to negate any warm fuzzy feelings I had about what I was eating. Again, I read many reviews that shower praise and adoration for Justine, and I know this was just my experience and my personal opinion ... but I just must be in a different crowd.   Simply put, there isn't a bowl of Pho good enough to warrant sitting through this barrage ever again.

G6Hrm81CAeFAXMZmS7x_bw.text: We stood by the door for 9 min. waiting for them to clean off a dirty table for us to sit down. I was surprised and annoyed they didn't do this sooner. I had the Hanoi Rice Vermicelli and I liked it very much. My partner had Mint Chicken and we both thought it was bland and boring but Justine was kind enough to replace it with what I had. I think a better price would be $10 instead of $13.50. I think it's cool that you can BYOB.

S36tNYZL0kX4CLmGODqxow.text: Beautiful Justine, the owner, seems to always there in a slinky dress and 4'' high heals (Ole).  She makes you feel like you have known before you've ever met.  She is a friendly host and smiling all the time.    My two favorite things are:   - the long beans and   - the beef salad.    Although the food is vietnamese, it seems more exotic.  I never get Pho here, which is my standard at all other Vietnamese places.  I guess I am too focused on the items above to even ask about Pho.    You can also bring your own bottle wine and open it at the restaurant for a small cork fee.

tQMX6_Qo5krd5TbkmRi9iw.text: I'm glad I read these reviews *after* I went there because there are some really (a) uptight  and (b) cheapa$$ people writing reviews and I wouldn't have wanted to have been dissuaded by them. Two friends/colleagues and I went there for lunch today; it was the first time for all of us.   The decor was bright, fun, and modern...from the clear plastic chairs, to the orange circles and abstract art on the walls. From the moment we walked in, the owner, Justina, catered to us, exchanged playful, witty, banter, and peppered her sentences with a healthy dose of f*ck, sh*t, and other "fiery" language. I loved it; it's exactly how I talk and interact with people I know.   She visited our table often. I didn't interpret this as an intrusion or her wanting to be "besties"; IMO opinion it was genuine attempt to provide attentive service and show us we were valued customers. I asked her how long she'd been operating the restaurant (12 years), where she moved from (CA), and what else she'd like to do in addition to or after the restaurant (I'll let you ask her and tell you herself).   The food was great (though, admittedly, I haven't had a lot of Vietnamese food. We had the spring rolls (the wrap was a bit chewy, so not the best I've ever had) and the Hanoi and Saigon Vermicelli (both of which were amazing: flavorful and fresh). Overall it was a very fun lunch experience and I will be returning to try other offerings. My friends concurred.  My recommendations: (1) Don't go there if you can't afford a $10-13 entree. That is *not* expensive and if you think it is maybe you stick to fast food and/or generic, cheap, run-of-the-mill places/chains; (2) Don't come with a stick up your butt. If you want to be "alone" with whoever you came with, maybe this isn't the place for you. Fine. Go find somewhere else where you can be antisocial. But, for those who'd like to expand their horizons and meet and talk to new, interesting people, have a convo with Justina; (c) If you're offended by swear words or don't appreciate acerbic wit, humor, and friendly banter, don't talk to the owner. In fact, don't come here at all. God forbid you get all butt hurt b/c someone said f*ck in public. We wouldn't want your meal to be ruined. Or next time BYOB and get drunk so you don't care as much about what others around you are doing or saying. For everyone else who likes a fun dining experience with good Vietnamese food, check out this place.

k4ymcsM1_Zzo5TGIGFyDqA.text: This place is more about ambiance than anything else. It's a Vietnamese restaurant for trendy hipsters-- complete with extremely liberal and free-spirited proprietor, Justine.  Although I like Justine, I can see how some might be turned off by her. But for me, she would be the main reason for frequenting this place. I like friendly and engaging staff, and I believe in supporting local business.   But the food is not particularly special. I've been here twice, and the meals have had little impact.  I like the atmosphere so much that I went again, hoping to fall in love with the food, but it just isn't happening. The flavor is too mild. And it makes me sad.   Arizona severely lacks culture and general character, so I want to support these types of restaurants so more will pop up. I might keep trying. Maybe I need to find *THAT ONE* dish that knocks my socks off. Here's hoping.

9D7xedKlWphFhmk9YNCxew.text: Always the best for hot soup on a cold night. Justina is a riot and always makes me laugh. Its great too because its BYOB! Highly recommend this place. Small and quaint inside. Homemade recipes

y5vF8nZbzRGN1QhRkO9qQg.text: The Pho Was WAYYYYYY OVER PRICED! $12 for a bowl! Yea at 1st I was like maybe it might be a big bowl, but nope I was freakin' wrong! Felt like I just got robbed!!  This place is over rated! Overall its your money, but I like gettin' my monies worth when I eat.

_S018HgS-aCwK7WQBj82nQ.text: Delicious food, and Justine is a an absolute creative beauty! Love everything about this place, including the atmosphere and food. YUM!!!

7UEtKUZ8n4qxO0BLmSoZDg.text: My favorite Vietnamese restaurant.  I crave the crispy noodle cakes and fresh spring rolls regularly.  I love the owner who remembers me and my food preference each time I return.  I wish I could find more local restaurants like this.

LAHZa6GO1HNuOVQfgcDbnw.text: Very very very warm and welcoming environment. You are greeted add soon as you walk in and seated with a nice glass of refreshing citrus water.  The food was delicious and authentic. I recommend this place if you are in the area and looking for authentic Vietnamese cuisine.

n5B4_15jvI8fUBb38JPNog.text: Best spring rolls I've ever had. Justina and her staff make then fresh when you order and they are always perfect. Never been disappointed by anything on the menu. Try the pho hai san if you like seafood!  Bring your own alcohol!  Seriously, I love this place.  Wish Justina had Cyclo restaurants all over the country. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pho hai san (seafood soup)

yvKPYpn9PCqT4bwk-TvgIw.text: OMG what is wrong with you Yelper's bragging about this place!  If this is the first place you ever had Vietnamese food you have been duped!  I have been there 3 times and I am done. Today was for lunch.  Cheap plastic furniture starts it off. We sit down at a table that was soaking wet and a older guy comes over with menus. Ten minutes later he brings us water. Five woman come in and sit down.  He brings them water. As he walks by I ask him if we can order. Nope he goes and takes the orders for the 5 women who of course get there food ahead of us and we now are there over 30 minutes.  Simple food ratings- Lemongrass chicken Dry as can be and it comes with no sauce. Pineapple Curry Chicken was terrible. Lastly the short ribs matched the other two dishes.  Other than the food runner the staff was not friendly.  Never again

wlzrQLPWdOs2bTjEkI2P-A.text: Upon the suggestion of a friend we stopped in for lunch. What a pleasant suprise. We were greeted by an owner and had 2 delicious meals! The Pad Tai noodles were very tasty and I even enjoyed the tofu. The house Lime-aid was fantastic and the location was nice.

Gjy7qcZs1d3i9KS_VuYYrw.text: I am always satisfied with Cyclo. I usually get their Saigon Vermicelli and their spring roll appetizer. Staff is friendly. It's BYOB. Friends have gotten pad Thai, curry and soup. All would recommend. I would probably suggest they review menu pricing but their portion sizes are really generous. I can usually wrap the rest of my dishes to go but not the soup. Dishes run about $13. I think they could offer a "regular portion" for $9.95. I would have got an extra appetizer.

yc9OI-m9tzpRi4iWgPiMXA.text: I found this restaurant through the Phoenix magazine 9years ago when I moved from Hawaii.  The food was okay, but I thought it tasted too commercialized and it was pricey.  I gave it another try after so many years.  My rating has not changed, food taste okay, but nothing spectacular.   Ambiance and cleanliness is excellent.

8c_lUa3sK-VkACtGHXT83w.text: So far, so good, I had the veggie spring rolls. The wrapping was nice and moist, the filling of rice vermicelli, fried tofu, and lettuce was moist and delicious. The dipping sauce was also excellent. If I could change one thing, I would add some cilantro inside the spring roll. I wouldn't mind trying a main dish here.

8IIkOwDyqbWCtfagYyHzpQ.text: Addicted to the spicy green beans :) and pan fried egg noodles are my go to main dish. I have tried several things that are good here but love the fried noodle with beef, shrimp and scallops. Husband loves the Pho, fried rice is great, lemon grass chicken, black pepper shrimp all good. If you chose wisely, it's not difficult to eat healthy here too which is a +.    We love to bring people here for the adventure...if they haven't had vietnamese before and then there's the Justina experience. She's a little spit fire and adds a ton of fun to the already great atmosphere. BYOB makes even more affordable.

AA7f8hfnm7JEAwYRFFsG8w.text: Horrible service. Asked 3 times to order, asked twice for a knife and what kind of Vietnamese restaurant doesn't have meatballs for your pho?

d1Uyl-EO59u41f3b20yAmQ.text: I really don't understand what the fuss is about with this place.  I had it years ago and thought it was horrible, but decided to give it a try again today with some co-workers. What a mistake!  First off, the food is horribly overpriced.  You can get a better bowl of pho at many other Vietnamese restaurants for half the price.  Taste wise, the pho was horrible.  It's all about the broth for a good bowl of pho, and it tasted like they just used beef broth from a can.  Additionally, the brisket smelled like it was spoiled.  Even my American co-worker thought the food tasted horribly.  This is the first time I have not left a tip at a restaurant.  It was that bad.  If you go to a Vietnamese restaurant and you don't see any Vietnamese people there, it should tell you something.

kwiDutogZvfIMHcL3DiaVA.text: Still the best Vietnamese in Arizona. A much more delicate touch on everything than typical Vietnamese food. Love it, and go here whenever I'm back in town.

mhnCdaJhadezLrb26DJzsA.text: well to start i will give this place 5 stars again and again. from the moment we walked in the door it was such a positive environment! we ordered a shrimp dish with some spring rolls and pho.  let me just tell you, it was the best we have ever had! the owner was the cutest little bohemian women who has the sweetest heart. her restaurant has exquisite decor and i love how eco friendly they are! i just loved everything about my dinner experience spent here! the food was hands down amazing but the service was even more impressive. we will definitely be returning customers!

FJHeFC62jcm-iyeOby8nnA.text: We've eaten here a few times now and they're never disappointed us! The staff is so so funny, always enjoy the conversation that's not just small talk but they take an interest in their customers and pride themselves on being a relaxes and fun environment.   I personally love Pho Tai, I usually get this at every Pho restaurant we go to, and I love theirs! The beef is very tender and melts in your mouth. The spring rolls are also very yummy. Very fresh ingredients that are not made way in advance like others out there.  Even if we couldn't walk here from our home I'd still drive past many other restaurants to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Infused water
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Spring rolls

F1Fpwyh5DQ_Q0QuyY0ULGQ.text: Super cute and trendy place w/ interesting decor and adorable cut fruit pieces in their water, definitely makes you take a step back and enjoy the surroundings while you wait!  Tried the pho, as I'm new to the area and on a pho hunt, and it was pretty good, but the portions are smaller than I'm used to and more expensive sadly. Pho broth was still 4 stars, good ratio of meat and noodles, fresh ingredients, can't complain. But if this is the best I can get in the area I'll take it! Wait staff is super friendly.

m48bkKCNt0qb78uS4Q3r5w.text: I have a cold, so I have been living off of soup for about a week now. Decided to try this place out since it was the closest pho option for me.  I balked at the $10 price point for the base beef pho on the lunch menu ( I am very spoiled by my regular spot, Saigon Pho's $5.95 pho lol) but they did have some interesting choices for seafood phos for $13. There was a snow crab one I was eyeing...but decided to just go for the standard one.   It was a perfectly good pho, although I really missed having tripe and tendon. All in all, a fine meal in a very colorful, chic environment. Oh, it was nice to have some variety of fruit in my water--that was a nice touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pho $10 lunch price
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Water with pear, strawberry, nectarine and lime, cute decor

97muFzlhIFo6CHE_0Tqeog.text: The food was delicious. The water is amazing . it was infused with pieces of pineapple, lime, pomegranate and cantaloupe.  The wait staff was so courteous and friendly. Very modern atmosphere. Can't wait to try the other dishes.

44NbRF9vopQgDeQ87h4bJA.text: Not that great taste. The pho was lacking its flavor and the fried rice was just an average. The service was little bit unprofessional though it did not bother me too much. The restaurant was small but ok. If u live close here, try it out. Otherwise, look for the better.

m-gbKMWbS6ED3JpfXbioJg.text: The food here is fresh and excellent, we've been here and few times and I'm a huge fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States

SaHJAqSoLDEHXba_bwUcRA.text: Came here because they're open later than my go tos! The ambience is nice and the staff is friendly.  The food was better than ok/good, but it definitely wasn't authentic, and the typical strong flavors were super muted- Americanized Vietnamese at its finest.  Along with that the prices are a little high, but I guess you're paying for the decor and the fruit water (which was good).

TQnuQYSkqMoi6IiP_LMhhQ.text: Lately, I've been eating a ton of Vietnamese food. The owner of this restaurant is super awesome! She talks to every one of her customers and is just hilarious.   I ordered the Pho Thai which was okay. It definitely wasn't bad, I just felt like it lacked flavor compared to other places I've been. I also felt it was a little pricey for Pho. Others in our party ordered the egg rolls and were very satisfied with those. And, someone ordered the lemongrass chicken which he raved about. I will definitely be back due to so many people I know loving this place and the owner being absolutely great, I will just be trying other menu items.

f8hi1aPw-slBOS-sqcAiiw.text: Wanting/craving Pho, for a solid dinner, yet I had only a short, short time frame, the owner took great care of my request. The restaurant had gorgeous flowers and decor. Even the water was presented artistically and was 'tastefully' refreshing!  Yum!  The Pho was fantastic... going back next week with time to sit and enjoy the dinner even more and the whole dining experience. I saw customers cared for like they were friends and family!! Can't wait!!

784txYCnPRVnbZnobjgaeQ.text: Funky little Vietnamese spot with interesting decor but overall an upbeat place. Owner was friendly and definitely had no filter which was hilarious. The infused water they offer is awesome with oranges, limes, mint and strawberries but the food was pretty mediocre I had the vermicelli and the pork and beef had not real flavor to it. Pad Thai was also pretty bland and not technically something you would find at a Vietnamese restaurant. Overall wasn't to impressed and was surprised to see such great reviews.

FANUD8d0vCrFddlFxD5Mqg.text: This is by far the best Vietnamese restaurant in Phoenix. The food is fresh and doesn't have added ingredients like msg. Gluten free options are available, diary free too, like the Thai iced tea. If you are vegan just let her know. There's even a vegan pho available. Unlike other restaurants justina can tell you exactly what's in the dish.  Justina, the owner is a True host. She gets to know all her customers but also give you space if you need it.   The service is impeccable. The water is always filled to the top in your glass. And the plates  cleared off the table when you're done. Speaking of water Justina puts fruit in her water and makes it naturally flavored with an essence of watermelon, mint, citrus or pomegranate seeds.  it's a True treat just to drink H2O. If you need it plain just ask!  People who eat at Cyclo are very friendly and I've sat there having a general conversation with complete strangers. Fun times.  And if you like beer or wine, bring it! It's Byob!

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken pho with veggies. Oh so yummy and good for you too!
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Yummy water with fresh fruit.

QgkYQ6xWCTxBnp0XVmSpIQ.text: Great flavor. Excellent service.  The decor is beautiful.  I look forward to eating at Cyclo again!

ANV1pvA_YbvyVrBgEqDmOA.text: Loved this place.  Cool atmosphere, great food!  Was greeted by the owner (charming lady) made us feel welcome rite away.   Definitely a place to try!

5ybVk-0qDcsIpHnCWXJwQA.text: Wow, just plain wow.  Everything about this place was like art work.  Even their water was a great experience.  I very much enjoyed my Pho and Vietnamese egg rolls, although I don't think egg is even an ingredient.  We t was all great and my waiter was even kind enough to offer to show me how to properly eat the rolls with the greens they are served with.  Fortunately, I am an experienced eater and handled it but I have never had anyone offer to explain it.  Great job, keep it up.

wExWdF6ZxmQXa0Q-0kBaaw.text: Ordered the pad Thai and spring rolls.. pad Thai was amazing! Everyone here is welcoming, and the food was quick and inexpensive. Definitely recommend

96ka2dS38GfUzYmgFIl7Ow.text: I feel like I would come here just to talk to the owner . I love her. She's so funny and warm and welcoming. The food is bomb. I always order take out on my way home from work and it never disappoints. I've had a bunch of different things on the menu but the Scallion Vermicelli bowl w beef or the PHO is my favorite. Good spring rolls too. A+ from me!

hWPJDLjA9bNGshigLmUoyg.text: Cute place, knowledgeable staff, great customer service and yummy food. Everyone I was with thought the same thing. The server(who I assumed was the owner) went above and beyond. I asked her if she had any herbal tea, she said they only had jasmine but then she said "oh I have a private stash and made me herbal tea anyway. Yay! Another great restaurant I can go to without getting sick. I have a gluten, egg, yeast and dairy allergy and I had no reaction after eating what the server suggested.

FCpetjTM0hX8-UztVasQig.text: Chic and trendy while still retaining a welcoming feel.   Looking for a quiet place to enjoy an Asian meal, I stumbled into Cyclo. Walking in I was immediately greeted by the animated owner, who made me feel instantly happy with my choice in venue. She recommended to go with the beef pho which was delicious and hit spot.   Oh, and they offer BYOB (bring your own booze). What more can you offer?

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Beef pho
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Restaurant floor

WvuGIFa5rTi_t7_qEXDFfg.text: We go there often, including just last week. Justine has updated the decor, with bold colors and chairs that are much better than what they used to have. My experience is she has toned down her "sassiness" recently - along with dressing very fashionably she may be updating her image also. It was a Thursday, we got the last open table at 6:15pm. I'm not an expert on VN food, but we love the food here. The portions seemed a bit smaller, but I suppose it's that or raise prices. We usually get several small dishes - beef salad, spicy green beans always have lots of flavor. It's casual enough my kids - ages 5 and 7 can walk around checking it out with no problems. I can see it being the type of place where service may vary depending on who is working and the customers.

HGTNqG583AbqsQBfol2AyA.text: Love this place! The food is excellent. The atmosphere is intimate. And Justine, the owner is a riot! She interacts with all her customers, and she has some serious personality! Don't forget to bring your own bottle of wine.

M3HABB64qcG-jDd2jwY8eQ.text: Great prices, just sized right portions with incredible flavors and the owner Justine makes it a lively festive experience. BYOB with no corking charge.

HNYfnZHmIPcP7lPCT_SfVQ.text: Fabulous food and sassy service - the perfect combination!

X8r98jfXXwFCwAV3mu6tOg.text: I agreed with reviewer, ' Ima yelp'.  What a rip off.  $12.00 for a small bowl of noodles. I find nothing special about their food that can justify double price.  Taste, texture, ingredient, serving size - everything is the same as other Vietnamese restaurants that normally charge between $5 -$ 7.00.

QqRIo9P2ETac6SiSLBzHQw.text: I ate here 5 nights in a row after I found this place in the summer of 2008. It was a very different kind of restaurant. The food and service was good and the owner's over abundance of personality provided the atmosphere / entertainment.   It reminded me of Pesto's before success ruined them. A small place where the owner had their thumb on the pulse to ensure a really good experience.   Cyclo's was also B.Y.O.B. which added to the uniqueness of the joint. The only reason I stopped going is, we had tried all the appetizers, desserts and most of the entrees on the menu. And it is too expensive to be a place to go for a daily fix of noodles and water. But definitely worth a visit if you haven't been there.

mYDMtFtaOEbzhQu1olxxQg.text: While I'm reviewing pho's, I'll give my review on Cyclo. This is where I'd take that cute Vietnamese babe I met last week. It has great atmosphere and the food is awesome. I ate here about a week ago and had their pho bowl and it was one of the best I have tried in the valley, I really loved it. The girl who seated us was really nice and gave an enjoyable contribution to the dining experience. Yes this place cost almost twice what I pay across town but worth it with the right company. My brother and I ate here and we both agreed we would probably not eat here together much but we will both be eating here again. AKA we thought this was alot better place to take a girl or a business associate than our fav pho in the area to have lunch together.  Cyclo has a more upscale atmosphere than the average pho and we both thought the food is above average. I don't agree with another reviewers post that the portions here are small. I had one appetizer with a pho bowl and left full.  I'm 6'3" 230 and like to eat ALOT and my brother who is shorter but heavier than me was complaining he ate too much after we left. One of the best phos in the east valley!

dvJiY0x_JTPIE4r2OsQIZA.text: Food was below average for Vietnamese food.  The beef in the pho was shredded and not thinly sliced like it's suppose to.  The waitress is also a big flirt.  Not impressed.

jL9CPcKeTvZWrIFMXY6vgw.text: Simply put, the many times I have eaten there have all been great experiences..from the food to the Owners attention..Justina is a floor show at every meal. It is consistently good and the byob policy gives it a for sure 5 stars for me..and no corking fee!

Vw-I5t6jqUWqYCCatq-YwA.text: Great. The owner just made us dinner. We didn't even look at a menu. No corkage fee on the wine. All good.

npB0JxSJTzbSh8tdMej4yw.text: I believe this place is over-hyped.  the menu is overpriced.  the portions are small.  the meat is low quality.  slow service.  sterile decor.

qNiZbBb2_RQO44Xxni0KrQ.text: One star is too much for this restaurant. My friends and I went there on a Thursday night and was treated with no attention or smiles.  The lady owner only pays attention to 2 things: swagging around in her short skirt and cloking 4inch heels. The food was way too over priced for such a casual,average tasting restaurant (a bowl of beef pho for 13 bucks...Come on!) and the variety of dishes they offer was very Very limited.   The most annoying fact about this restaurant is that you cannot share certain food with others unless you pay 2 dollars extra! (written on their menu)   Save yourself from wasting time and money and head over to Da Vang for authentic, large, cheap Vietnamese cuisine.

moU7NKI1E40JWj9y94IBkw.text: I live in the NE valley and a drive to Chandler is not an easy one...But knowing that on the other of that drive is a worthwhile is priceless.  Cyclo is just that place...It's a small hole-in-the-wall next to a Subway in a strip mall.  you'd probably pass it and not know it's there.  It's a hidden gem that a lot of people know about, but hasn't lost its integrity.  I have been there a number of times and each time loved it more... It's BYOB...Great!  Bring exactly what you want to drink...How many times have you seen a menu without a drink you want?  You show up and wait...but, it's well worth it.  The owner is worth it alone.  She is fun, young and has a sharp tongue...Come ready! I asked her last time what she recommends or eats daily:  rare sirloin soup ( sorry, veggies! ).  I then asked how she eats it:  a bunch of Sriracha and garlic...WOW!  She was even cool enough to stay after closing and just talk to us about life, running and the restaurant she is so proud of...Well done indeed! I have two reasons to go to Chandler:  Cyclo and IKEA :) Worth every cent in gas....

nRZLxB9VZStMDLZpa8nHDg.text: Very good food.  The restaurant had a cool vibe and great artwork.  Was very clean and the service was great.  I had the Beef Pho and it was excellent.

hFELP1m9P5yVPnMIgBtsmQ.text: I had high hopes for Cyclo ( pronunced see-klo). Alas, it was not to be. Although the place is clean and classy and the prices reasonable, the service leaves A. LOT. to be desired. Both times we visited, the staff were unpleasant and downright rude. Too bad, since the pho bo vien (a delightfuul blend of slender rice noodles, beef meatballs, bean sprouts and herbs) could have been magical...

G8c-8fi9kyN98hxY-BuOag.text: I couldn't agree with David more.  The owner is definitley an interesting  person.  The more money she thinks you make, the more she will talk to and love you!  So tell her you are RICH!! (Sorry Didi C.) As for the food -  Ho hum VN food at high for what you get prices.  The Pho is very avg and double the usual price. They don't charge a corkage fee for  BYOB which is nice.

LVSu02nSzxDlFtcIPm5BAw.text: I went here for lunch this week with my 65-year-old mom.  We were impressed by the atmosphere, but the prices are the same at lunch as at dinner, which seems like a bit much.  The hostess/waitress/owner?? was very friendly and personable, at first; then a little *too* friendly and didn't seem to take the hint that we weren't into that much small talk.  Here's the best part:  when my mom ordered, she asked if she could please have a fork.  The h/w/o said, "No."  Not even apologetically!  She said: "Nope, you're going to learn to use chopsticks."  We laughed awkwardly -- ha, ha! -- and when the entrees came out, mom said, "Seriously, can I please have a fork?"  And again: "No!"  She didn't explain, and she didn't apologize.  We thought it was weird, but you know what, maybe they didn't have any forks, and mom did fine, and whatever.  BUT as we were paying our bill, we looked across the room, and there was a guy in his mid-twenties or so USING A FORK!!!!   Cyclo, why give some dude a fork and not a nice older lady who asks you politely TWICE??  If I had been there with my inlaws, you better believe they would have stormed the hell out in a hurry.  Don't know if I'll go again -- food was nice, but expensive, and I don't want to embarrass any future guests I might bring there.   So, BYOFork!

Vm-jMzkLl8BaTPu2RqzeLw.text: 4 times I was there, the food was satisfactory. As a Vietnamese from Saigon, just came here for school, I have to say Cyclo is the one that is clean, in good neighborhood and still has the most authentic Pho. In AZ, most "authentic" places, for some reasons, are either dirty or in sketchy neighborhood. The clean and nicely decorated ones tend to "americanize" Pho to please majority of patrons.  Other dishes are delicious, maybe a bit varied from being authentic, but still amazing: Pork Short Ribs, Crispy Rice Crepe, Green Papaya Salad (my fav, and pretty close to what you would find in Vietnam), Spicy Garlic Green Beans. At first I was surprised, and rather amused to find guests bringing wine here. I guess certain reviews molded this restaurant into a fine dining. While the place is quite chic, pairing wine with Vietnamese cuisine like the ones here is .... very very odd. Heineken beer perhaps, but wine? Better save that bottle for a French-Vietnamese fusion bistro. One thing about Cyclo that bothers me is they need to turn the AC lower. 3 out of 4 times I was there, our group ended up sweating.

imivnF0CzhXf0Eco1mQbTw.text: Justina is fabulous! The food is amazing. This is a great date night for my wife & I. Love love love it!  We bring guest in with us and everyone always loves it!

rPURAE62ev1WKA8H57A0dQ.text: Cyclo is pretty cool.  Here you will find the most stylish, eclectic and entertaining hostess Justina, the most expensive pho EVER (a huge bowl never costs more than $6 in CA), and the entire Intel staff.  Sometimes I'm the only there w/o a badge.   My favorite here is the BYOB option.  The Pho is excellent, not $11 excellent but if I can drink my cabernet with my pho...hey no complaints here.  Spring rolls are the best I've had anywhere because the beef strips are actually grilled and it makes all the difference. The chili green beans and lemongrass chicken are signature dishes and are consistently well made.  They also made the food LIGHTENING fast which can make you feel rushed... because a nice bottle of red should never be rushed.  The place is small so go on downtime if you can to avoid standing outside and staring at the irresistible view of Basha's Grocery across the street.

7NQ7sYutFh5oVoGAaGYrsA.text: Best Vietnamese place I've eaten at outside of New York City.  Maybe even the best Asian food I've eaten in the Phoenix area.  And it's inexpensive!  I would be a regular if I lived out there.  It's really one of the better eateries in the Phoenix area.
