VefY4ru2VTsUNDgwNnWlHA.text: Food is amazing!  True definition of a local joint! Justina is a riot and why I go back every time!

66PfF9zNF6TfGxLgcGjQjA.text: The pho is fab... and the seafood with rice cakes awesome!

_yfVhszJnvoALmXHVZ2yfw.text: After reading the reviews here, we decided to check out Cyclo since it's right down the road.  I can't believe we never went there before, it was REALLY good.  The food was spectacular, and the service was great.  It was affordable, and the owner wasn't quite as wild as we read.  She was energetic, but not overbearing.  We got there a little early, which was good because it got really busy later.    SPECIAL NOTE:  It's one of those rare places where you can bring a bottle of wine, or some beers if you want to.  There is probably some fee for it, but it would have made our date perfect.  We had the garlic green beans (I would have NEVER thought of eating a full plate of green beans could be so scrumptious) , the curry/pineapple chicken (yummy and not too sweet, and finely tuned), and the Bun Sai Gon (Saigon Rice Vermicelli)...  all were A+ dishes and had very intricate flavor combinations.  We had three dishes and the bill was about $25 after a healthy  tip.

FMraW7SwhTKDDkP_sDWqEg.text: I normally don't take the time to write reviews on anything but my experience at this place motivated me to create a yelp account.  First, the owner was irritating and sarcastic. I almost wanted to tell her to leave us alone so we can eat. She must think she is something. Second, the food was average, I have had far better vietnamese food. Third, servings were small for the price we paid for. Fourth, this place is RIDICULOUSLY expensive for a vietnamese place. Last and certainly not the least... I don't recommend this place. Went there once and will never ever go back again. Bad place guys, not worth your time and money.

TRMDJc1FxnbGEvKoWr1QkA.text: So my buddy brought me here as a get way from  he corporate world.Hmmm very orangy type of place and the owner well......very enthusiastic. The place is small but nice. Now the food was good....spring rolls were interestingly yummy and the noodle bowl i had was actually not bad at all (bun sai gon?) it was a big bowl as real Vietnamese restaurants do. They even had a chili at the table and not sirachi sauce...so thumbs up.

Ba8JN_Y3eG3bUJaV8VK56A.text: I'm surprise there aren't more reviews for Cyclo.  Bonus points if you pronounce it correctly (See-Klo).  I love this place.  The owner, Justina, is a hoot and really keeps the place running smoothly.  And if you're there more than once, chances are she'll remember you.  Cyclo is a haul for me from Central Phoenix, so it's not a super regular stop for me, maybe once every 6-8 weeks.  But, Justina remembers me and chats with me.  That's great service.  Cyclo is another BYOB and, Lord knows, I love that.  No corking fee.  Now, this isn't fancy.  Paper napkins and plastic cups, but dang, it's good.    Faves include: Green beans.  These aren't your ordinary green beans, they're chili and garlic green beans and they make me want to be a vegetarian. Tamarind ribs.  On the app menu, they are so tasty and tender and tangy.  I wanna lick the plate, but that's not lady like. Lemongrass Chicken.  Lil' nuggets of lemongrassy love.  Chicken deep fried and infused with lemongrass.  So simple and delicious.  Everything we've had here is wonderful and calling it reasonable is a laugh, it's downright cheap.  We were four for dinner with apps and entrees and tea for $50.  That's a deal!  They are now open for lunch, but no lunch menu.  It's the same menu all day long.    No reservations and the wait can be long.  I suggest going at lunch time or for an early dinner or be prepared for wait for a bit.  On the same note, this isn't a place that you sit and linger after you've eaten.  Be considerate of those is line, pay your check and get outta there!

zNSgmOlveoEgPUdVgiif0A.text: The foods are very similar to authentic Vietnamese foods.  You can't really tell the differences if you are not a Vietnamese.  The owner is extremely friendly.  She will stop-by and ask "how is your day going?  What is going on your life?"  She really listen to you.  Not a fake person.  I like her.    The place itself is clean and modern.  Very nice decor. :)  It is good to take your date to come here.    I think it is a good place for group.  I had my graduation dinner here.  The foods came up pretty fast.  You need to alert the owner though, so she can have extra server/cook.  For kids?...Uhm....Lifetime Fitness have a "parent-night-out" night?

Dw4n0K8pk5aeW2Rfh5cIQg.text: So it has been a looooooong time since I have eaten at Cyclo and had an opportunity to have a little Vietnamese lunch so there I sat.... waiting for my friend.  The place looks great!  lively fun new interior.  I was sat promptly and offered water with a bit of mint (nice touch).    I ordered the short rib appetizer and crispy chicken.  My friend ordered the mixed grill.  The short ribs as I remember did not disappoint.  Succulently flavorful making me dream of taking a full order of them home just to smell in the car!  The crispy chicken had great flavor, but was a little over cooked.  (of course that didn't stop me from eating it.)  My friend really liked the mixed grill and loved the atmosphere.    Before I would have given 5 stars, but today a 4.  Don't let that stop you from trying though... It is definitely worth trying and I'd say a little more lively at dinner.

vjwC-eKdHS3FjdlVoEYObw.text: I've been eating at Cyclo for many years now and I have never had a bad meal.   I always start with the black pepper shrimp and since I've switched to a mostly vegetarian diet the past two years my choices have narrowed a bit, but Justina always modifies the food so it fits.   Over the years I've had pretty much everything on the menu and whenever a friend asks me what to get I say, "Close your eyes and point, you won't be disappointed".   The Vietnamese coffee at the end of dinner is a perfect ending to any meal.   The desserts are great and when I do get it I like the Mango Sticky Rice or the Creme Brulee. Both will not disappoint.   Justina is a great and I think it is funny when people take her too seriously. She has fun with her customers and they should have fun with her. She can take it as much as she can dish it out so just relax.   There have been some comments that when Justina is not there the experience is not the same. How could it be? There is only one Justina and once you get to know her you'll realize she is really much more than a crazy hostess. She is a really nice person.   I hope you enjoy Cyclo as much as I have.

dP9LKcmZ2lfiiI5iu-Y9wg.text: Forgot to mention owners rude behavior while there last.  Just classless.  Swearing and extremely inappropriate subject matter for a business with guests. It almost seems like she didn't give a darn about anyone or anything. Too bad. This place had potential.

P9CnD5wsIVq8LG3IYBh-NQ.text: Wow~that really is too bad that this place was put on the Dirty Dining list!  But then maybe all those roach legs are the "secret ingredient"?  hahaha i'm just kidding.  If I were to take the Dirty Dining aspect out of the review, I would recommend this place to people who are venturing out into Vietnamese cuisine.    The owner is very friendly and knows my sister and her friends pretty well.  Whenever we go in, she takes our bottle(s) of wine (gotta love the BYOB!) and immediately opens them up.  She chats with us for 10-15 min., and always takes our order.  When it comes to cozy atmosphere, this place is definitely at the top!  The reason I stated that this place is a good introduction to Vietnamese fare is that I personally felt that the flavors were more suited to a Westernized palate.  Their spicy chicken dish (the name escapes me!) is quite good, but reminds me of Orange Chicken: it's not Chinese-Chinese, but Chinese-style American!  Of course, the dish I always get is pho.  The broth is not as pungent as the broth you might get at the pho shop next to LeiLei's, but is savory and allows you to taste the basil and bean sprouts and lime you put in!  I give it 4 stars because of atmosphere, the very accommodating nature of the restaurant owner, and the general cuisine.  I don't give it 5 because of the essential nature of the pho itself.  To me, pho is the perfect hangover food.  The pho at Cyclo is light and perfect for dinner, but not for the morning after a rough night!

2_T_2UH1nh6Oh7p3aRlagg.text: Great place.  Worth the drive if you live far away, plus the owner is sweet and funny- she'll remember you after just a couple of visits. But be prepared, because she likes to give you a hard time!  You can bring your own wine here, which is great.  The food is reasonably priced and excellent.  I love, love, love the garlic green beans.  They're so good, spicy and flavorful- get them for sure!  I also like the tofu and veggies, pad thai and the seafood noodle soup.   It's not your everyday restaurant, and that's what I like about it.  The flavors are unexpected, making the food a treat for anyone unaccustomed to it.  And it's a charming place to go on a date or spend some time with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States

tF4nIS31obhEQSiSzikt-g.text: Have been to Cyclo twice. Both times the food was very good.  Ate both times in the late afternoon. Good service...an unanimated, but effiicient staff.   Start with the pork and shrimp spring rolls, move on to the crisp lemongrass chicken or pad thai, end it with one of their unique desserts...and you have a meal that is sure to satisfy!   Beware the plum soda! LOL That's all I have to say about that...

UCObTXnIND4l1noIQJG3XQ.text: The food is great, but it's a little more expensive than all the other Pho places around Chandler (and there are a lot!).    However, the green beans are absolutely amazing, a must have.

fN_3G8wShpAF2h9Bzmg-_A.text: I was there on opening night. Simply the classiest Vietnamese restaurant I've been in outside of the Bay Area. Definitely worth checking out! A little pricier than the hole-in-the-wall places around town, but you get what you pay for. If ambiance is important to you, it'll be worth the few dollars more.

A-mcpZ4xp4WaQq5j3NcsKw.text: The best food served up by the BEST owner.  This place is family owned and run.  Half the fun is meeting Justina and enjoying her style and sense of humor.  Order ANYTHING and you will enjoy it.  If you love Pho, then this is the ONLY place in AZ where you can get a bowl that lives up to the name.  In a state that has very few truly GREAT food options, this is one of the FEW that is truly great.

9MJqGxVOp3pd5CqjGWI3Wg.text: Absolutely beautiful decor.  Tasteful, interesting, makes you feel as though you've escaped the desert.  Spring rolls were tasty, salad was intense but delicious in its way.

nzy_iGlzvqY8Lpzq0f0HeQ.text: Love Justina...!  She's got a great attitude to accommodate any type of customer.    Small joint but some of the freshest and tastiest Vietnamese around.  The lemongrass chicken, green beans, and any of the pho (Vietnamese soups) are Awesome!    Try the Vietnamese coffee for a treat.  UPDATE:  Cyclo is closed on Sundays and Mondays  Watch out for the busy lunch crowd... To get a seat I try to get there as close to 11am as possible.  This is one of my favorite valley restaurants.

QJtTJfolF_stLCiKcy2ByQ.text: I went here because of a lot of reviews said it was good.  Well, it's okay.  Nice for a fun date night or if that's all that was available to you.  I had the spring rolls... those were okay.  I had their pho.  It was okay.  The thai tea was nice.  The wait staff was friendly... not the fastest, but having been around many many many Asian restaurants and their workers, I'm not going to care about the service as much as I do the food.  I felt the prices were a little high for what you get, too.  Do yourself a favor... have the pho or the barbecue at Yen Mi... and if you want really really really good pho and spring rolls... help yourself to a little hole in the wall on 19th Ave. called Da Vang.  HANDS DOWN the best pho on the planet.

X5Hk300tyHBBE3TOLfHb_A.text: Finally tried this Cafe. Clean and fresh appearance. Very attentive service from young man. Started with the short ribs app, they were delicious, in a perfect tamarind glaze. Spring rolls were perhaps the best I've ever had. My Saigon bowl was very tasty, fresh and clean. Marinated pork tender and flavorful. Had the mango and sticky rice dessert, hate to say I have had better. Mango was perfect, but rather small portion. Sticky rice good, but made with a purple rice, different texture than the usual white. Overall very good meal. A bit pricey for smaller portions than used to. Owner came over to chat. Verrry interesting!

YamNTORaUL9S0McphlFbnQ.text: This a wonderful place to enjoy quality pho! The owner is wonderful and friendly and treats every customer as family. I can't wait to come back the best pho in the valley pho sho!

ImUOQ1c5hi9olav6W41X2A.text: This is a great little spot. The atmosphere is beautiful and bright with fresh flowers on the tables. The water has cool fruit in it which is nice touch. We had the the black pepper shrimp, egg rolls, beef short ribs, lemongrass chicken and sea food pho. The shrimp is so delicate and full of flavor. I wanted to kill the plate right there but I was sharing and had to be considerate of my mom and grandma and make sure they got some too. The egg rolls were delicious and my mom and grandma devoured them. The lemongrass chicken had this amazing crunchy texture and was full of so much fresh flavors. And the pho came in a huge bowl and we all shared it. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the beef short ribs. Not because it lacked flavor cause that was definitely not the case, but because there were too many bones and I had to work too hard to eat it. Now, one thing made our trip extra nice, our server and host is absolutely hilarious and she likes to stop and chat. We fell in love with her and all her sassafras from her personality to her bejeweled denim jacket.

xKta7NvdJObZ7PbXchaCbg.text: My friend introduced me to the owner, Justina. What a funny women! She welcomed us into her restaurant with open arms and delicious food. My close friend is Asian and a lover of fancy things, she had been bragging about this place for months. Cyclo completely lived up to its hype. The environment is modern with accent lighting and fresh flowers in water on every table. The water is diffused with exotic fruit. We ate spring rolls, green papaya salad, pho, a crepe dish called Bang XEO and mango sticky rice. We drank the home brewed passion fruit Kambucha. Exquisite. Everything was delicious, crisp, fresh, and hit the spot! You can tell that every detail is carefully planned and well executed. The integrity and careful preparation of the food is what sticks out the most. Thank you Justina such an extraordinary culinary experience! This was the best Vietnamese food I have ever had

Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States

2ShutHB_ND14UBjEs_hwHQ.text: Still love coming here. We have been loyal customers since they opened and now bring our kids. No matter how long it has been, she greets us and our kids by name. They put fresh fruit and herbs in the water so you don't think you're in Chandler ;) Cyclo is the best! You won't be disappointed.

qYXu8hOwd9fvBBjYOgeOBg.text: Most bizarre dinner I've ever had! Im ok with people using the F word, but it's so awkward and ridiculous to hear it 175 times by the owner when you're just trying to have a nice, quiet, uneventful dinner. Food was good but that lady is crazyyyyyy! Would go back for take out only.

T996OX50BDF_o5YxD7TV4Q.text: I have been going to Cyclo for years as a neighborhood standard. My family has celebrated many birthdays and graduations at Cyclo over the years.  The owner, Justina, is a clever, funny and foul-mouthed treasure.  Customer service is excellent and feels quite personal.  The pho options are fantastic, but I have a soft spot for beef chow fun and spring rolls.The fruited water is spectacular and is so refreshing in the AZ heat!  I also love that we can bring our own bottle of wine (a huge money saver).  Be prepared for irreverence, hilarious observations, and a few  f-bombs thrown into your dining experience.  No other place like it!

4LhW6TlEtR2viVeWRHA-Xw.text: First time visitor and was pleasantly pleased. Nice decor, very good service and exceptionally clean. The food was served quickly. Black peppered shrimp appetizer was good, wish the shrimp were a little larger but very tastey. Seafood noodle soup was very good. Great flavor and quite filling. Prices were very good. The owner Justina is a real fire cracker. Great personality and most certainly makes you feel welcome  I'll definitely go back and look forward to my next visit.

NTr_t8uc-ItE-HZjGQtYLQ.text: So I do want to start out by saying the food is amazing I would recommend anything on the menu.   BYOB- what more can you ask for besides being able to bring in your own booze! I eat out a lot so it can get very pricey when you order drinks with dinner.   The owner Justine- she is Awesome but PLEASE be prepared for cussing and playful hazing, do not come if you don't have a sense of humor!!! But honestly she is very sweet woman, for example she hugs everyone on the way out.   Overall this place rocks and it's a foodie paradise!   TIP-I would recommend tipping a few extra bucks if you bring your own booze because they store it for you and bring it out for you and will open it

UBX7-U6zAnvm_WQuUH4PgQ.text: Nice option for Vietnamese food and a quick lunch.   Service is prompt and the dishes come quick. I like the fact that there are plenty of small plates to choose from if you're looking for something on the lighter side.   I've been stopping in off and on for years and it has always been worth my time.

Q8E372YqDFIwn-CIcOFNjA.text: Mean Justina cooked us the most delicious vegan pho you could ask for. They kick up the spice in the broth which is tastefully noticeable and hit you with some purple and orange cauliflower amidst the veggies. Love the owner, love the food, love the setting. Looking forward to being a regular again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States

hYAzBLKE_J2GqzDTG6jOzQ.text: Tonight was our first visit to Cyclo, and we were wowed to say the least. I have never felt more welcome at a restaurant. The woman who sat and served us was so sweet. She interacted with our kids. She made jokes. The gentleman who served us as well was equally as funny and accommodating. On top of the outstanding service, the food was delicious! Great service...check! Excellent food...check! Cute atmosphere...check! It was a great experience. Reasonable prices...check! We will definitely be back!

bbGF2nQdVPT7NHs3fd04mA.text: Best pho in Arizona by a mile! Friendly staff. Decor is stylish and interesting. Refreshing and original fruit water. Fast service. Very reasonable prices. Felt so happy after-- this is definitely "well being" food.

2w1eYTEwfc5_x7db8omk4g.text: Very interesting Vietnamese restaurant name.   Anyways, I ordered a papaya salad and a rare steak pho. Both were  mediocre at best. I feel like they lack the authentic flavors in both dishes.   Service was good though!

_jaEURtujotlE7CsSRN2aA.text: Love this place!! The owner is hilarious and will come around and talk to everyone. The service is quick and food is good. You can even bring your own wine and they will cork it for you for free. Whatever you don't drink they will re-cork for you. The pad Thai delicious

4rz35aOtb7oWgIeYeY-mDw.text: One of our favorite restaurants ever. Definitely best Vietnamese in Phoenix! We love the fresh ingredients and the friendly staff.

fz_BvqBsnG6defP1_m_dxw.text: This has to be one of my favorite places to go while my husband is in Chandler Regional Hospital! Went with my mother-in-law a few weeks ago and really enjoyed our time here. The pho was so, so good and the owner was hilarious! I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for some good food and even better company!

v5vlTRjsIZIPD48abRfCCQ.text: Ordered the Pho Thai soup. Mint leaves,  bean sprouts,  lemons and chili pepper   Water with lime, orange, Mint Leaves, red pomegranate was actually pretty good. I generally don't like lemon in my water, but this really worked and was good.  The Pho Thai has good tasting soup base along with the option of adding an assortment of items to enhance the Pho.  This a long way from our house but if we are in the area will be glad to go back again.
