92p2P9PCBAmy4nDlIsey4w.text: Looking for  chicken Pho, first placed that popped up when I searched. Pho was missing fresh jalapeno for my liking.  Spring rolls were delicious. The only thing I did not enjoy was the short ribs as they were bone in and fatty.  The customer service was great

0wEsUZCq1JL5aysorKwOsw.text: Delicious. I go about 3 times a week for lunch. The Xl rare beef Pho is my go to. The spring rolls are fresh and delicious every time. The owner is very entertaining and polite. I just love her potty mouth lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. XL Rare Beef Phò. Nom Nom Nom

Bekad5AMt7k9eMRM_X4PSA.text: Great ambiance, simple yet elegant menu, and consistent service and food. I visit Cyclo every other week and it's always a pleasant experience. Plus, to converse with the owner, Justina, is a delight. Witty, fashion and fabuchic!

l2819ZmXzaoBcGCbC0P9pQ.text: I've been a customer here for a few years now and love the food!  We usually get the pho noodle soup, banh xiao, and sometimes the spicy beef salad....all to die for!  I wanted to mention how sweet the owner is.  A friend of mine met me for lunch there with my very picky son. I was ordering a plain bowl of rice for him...and she intervened, lol...she told him she would make him something special that he would like.  He told her he liked chicken, so she went into the back and made or had someone make him a version of the lemongrass chicken cut into small bites without too much spice or seasoning...on top of rice.  My jaw dropped to the floor when he enthusiastically ate almost every bite.  She didn't want him to be hungry at her restaurant.  I just thought that was above and beyond....loyal customer for life!

KYTIOTQSaSnOE8ZYW3X2vQ.text: The food at Cyclo is entirely over-shadowed by its outrageous owner, Justina Duong.  If Justina was a gay man, she would make a great drag queen.  I think she's a hoot, but her outlandish behavior and brash comments do not work for everyone.    I have a very dear friend who lives in Chandler and she and I would go into Cyclo quite often.  My friend is married with three kids, but just she and I would go in.  She would always tell Justina about her family and show her pictures of the kids.  Justina really gets into teasing the customers and after a couple of years, she told my friend, "You crazy fag-hag.  You never bring your family in here.  You just come in with your gay friend.  You don't even have a family.  Crazy Lady, you just carry around those pictures to make your lonely self feel better."  Justina also plays up the Vietnamese accent.  She can be off-putting at first if you don't know what's up, but the floor show never disappoints if you're willing to play along.  The food is good enough now, but it was better when the restaurant first opened.  The star dishes include Tom Rang Hat Tieu, an appetizer of shrimp on toasted baguette slices with a savory black pepper sauce that is plate lickin' good.  Another delicious starter is Banh Xeo.  It's a crispy rice crepe with shrimp, pork, sprouts, and lettuce leaves for wrapping the crepe slices before you eat them.  For entrees, Ca Ri Ga is a tasty chicken and pineapple curry and Com Tam is a mixed grill of a marinated pork chop, beef, shrimp, and egg over broken rice.  As a side dish, the Dau Xanh Xao Toi is a sublime preparation of spicy garlic green beans with chili and sweet soy.    However, the quality now varies.  The last time I went the pineapple curry was totally bland.  Even though I have eaten at this place many times, I didn't say anything because I didn't want to be bothered with Justina's reaction.  Instead, I haven't been back.    I have been into Cyclo when Justina was not there and the quality of the food was nowhere near the same in her absence.  My concern is that Justina has announced plans (yet again) to open a second Cyclo in the Valley.  This time it's supposed to be on Central Avenue south of Camelback and across from Brophy with a fall 2008 opening.  Once that place opens, I assume Justina will move her floor show to central Phoenix and I am left to wonder if the quality of the food will continue to slip in Chandler.  Cyclo has a BYOB policy and some people are really into it.  For me, it's not a huge selling point.  I prefer not to schlep my own booze to a restaurant, but it's cool if you're into it.  If you go to Cyclo, hope that Justina is there.  You're really going to Cyclo for Justina's antics rather than the food.

CeNsSR8q1_w3RHXuzT3ZOQ.text: Cyclo is over-hyped in my opinion. Two major set-backs for me is the rude and curt owner-hostess, Justina Duong. She is just plain obnoxious and fails in her attempt to be humorous and charming. She actually believes that she is a culinary standard bearer in the Valley.  The other is based on several breeches of hygienic standards. I have seen stuff that made me cringe. I love pho and Vietnamese food beaucoup, but I won't return on foot, taxi, car or pedal car.  Call me a Dinky Dau Long Nose, but I just don't get the appeal.

jCuqZ-K96UFBvIxPHcva5Q.text: Yes, I'm giving them 5 stars. I know their prices are a little higher and people complain that it's more fusion than anything. I want to tell you why I love this place.   Before Cyclo opened I used to go to the pho restaurant on Apache. I would get my customized fried rice-- chicken, shrimp, beef, eggs, and vegetables. They put a charred grilled pork right on top and I was in heaven.   Justine worked at the Apache restaurant. What a character. I love her attitude mixed with charm. She has a good humor and fresh outlook on life. I always looked forward to her crazy stories. More importantly she gave great advice on how to deal with boys. Cyclo became my comfort food therapy sessions. And that is why Cyclo gets five stars.

g_b0H8M5BqYrfVXQz_OWyg.text: The pho was good and a generous portion, but compared to most Vietnamese places... way over priced. The owner is very nice and entertaining :) The spring rolls were decent, but smaller than most places for the price. It still beats anything in the west valley.

D0DewdIaeEkJCZsJUdu7Sw.text: I only truly crave a couple of dishes and the Saigon Noodles at Cyclo is one them.  Every now and then I need to go in and get my "fix", LOVE IT!  The restaurant is clean, the owner oversees the place daily and the service is fast & attentive.  Give it a try.

xrRwBMIVZhPdLJSV9Ug3AQ.text: Not sure why it's taken me so long to review Cyclo. I've been going for a very long time guess I was too busy eating to yelp.   Cyclo has some serious personality. Oh wait that's Justina! :) Cyclo does have a lot of personality to it with it's stylish decor and Justina just adds more to it. I really like the fact she comes and visits all the tables. Heck she's even sat down with us before. Love it when the owner likes to make nice with their patrons.  P.S - don't forget to bring your vino!  Onto the food...it's always fresh and flavorful. I've never had a bad experience here. The Pho is great, lemon grass chicken vermicelli is awesome and the green beans and pancake...Mmmmm!   This is the type of place I like bringing out of town guest to. You always know service is going to be good and there's no gambling with the food. I'm a fan Cyclo!

STlSIApRDY_o51Hh1jG8SQ.text: We really like this place.  I love the owner.  She is fun, smart, sassy and cute.  Always attentive to your needs.  I have been for lunch and dinner.  There are things I LOVE here- the green beans are SOOO good.  I could drink the sauce!  The Pho is amazing and I always love the vermicelli at any Vietnamese place.   I will continue to come and eat here.  It is probably the best Vietnamese food in the east valley with a good ambiance.  Bring your own wine if you want a glass with dinner.  Bring your Visa they don't except American Express.

TzJc6EPULlInOPdbrleiOg.text: Once again, a wonderful dining experience. We've enjoyed many incredible meals and tonight's was no exception. The owner, Justina, adds so much to me experience- like dining with a good friend. The garlic green beans are exceptional. Beef Chow Fun, egg rolls, papaya salad, all were great. Never disappointed. Plus bringing our own adult beverages make this a great value. Loved it!

nozJwkl9ptKAcAYlLYm5Xg.text: I have been wanting to try Cyclo for quite some time, and was definitely satisfied. However, the extreme hype surrounding this restaurant along with the numerous Valley awards it has received, probably led me to give it less than 5 stars since I didn't feel my dinner was worth endless raving.  The atmosphere is super cute and intimate, and service was very personable. If wanting to take a date to a Vietnamese spot, this would definitely be better than your rundown hole-in-the-wall, although much more pricier.  We started off with the spring rolls, egg rolls, and Thai Iced Tea. I hear their "Made to Order Lemonade" is also superb. My friend and I went with traditional Pho, while another got the Mi Xao Don (Pan Fried Egg Noodle) which was good, but would suggest the Pho because of its tasty broth.  My only negative remark is that it didn't have boba drinks or Vietnamese sandwiches like many smaller finds (Pho Avina in Glendale continues to be one of the best I've found in the Valley!), yet I would still recommend a visit.

jpHTwAfW0BP8nMeSggh76w.text: I was NOT impressed.  The only two positives were the no corkage fee for BYOB and the made to order lemonade.  The food was bland and boring at best.  My friend had to send back her pan fried noodles that tastes like sawdust.  I would not go back.

1O1JgvScQzCLG90c470Cuw.text: Great food, terrific service.  The owner is super funny and very thoughtful.  Go here!

bMw3vNhsEY75s0XBXBJn4g.text: You gotta love Justina, the owner...I just don't know why she keeps chopping her hair off. But she is like a walking fashion show.   Anyway, we have been going to Cyclo since its early days. Coming from the Bay Area, we were a bit disappointed that there were no decent Asian restaurants in the area, until we stumbled upon this restaurant. The flavors of the foods are amazing, really rich and sometimes a bit complex. Try the Hanoi and the shrimp appetizer...yum! And I truly enjoy the refreshing lemonade...a bit on the sweet side, but strangely refreshing! You have to go! Oh, and you can bring your own wine...just make sure it's a good bottle. Justina's going to make a note of it if you bring a cheap one.

RIy5KZhetkNTJXwOyQ1l6w.text: I went to Cyclo due to a review I found in a guide book.  It seems whenever I'm on the road, I'm in search for pho.  The decor on the inside is cute and modern,  not what you'd expect looking from the outside.  Reading from previous reviews, I guess I met Justina.  I love her originality and eccentric-ness.  But I didn't love the menu prices.  Sorry, but here in OC I can't imagine paying $9 for pho!  It was good, but the soup wasn't hot enough for me.  The beef was pretty darn tasty though.  And the Vietnamese coffee was just right.  It was nice that they served it in. . .actually, I don't know what it's called.  The coffee drips into a cup of condensed milk.  Then you mix it and pour it into a glass of ice.  Now I wish I had ordered a dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States

FochP7jkPNVCwtHdABRS1g.text: I can't get enough of this place. The food is great, the hostess, Justina is a riot, and because it is BYOB I can have a nice dinner with the SO for a pretty effective price. My wife loves the crepe, and the beef carpaccio is super good. When I'm not feeling 100% - the Pho lights my phire.

mXWGsCHGVyrai0Y53rKcrg.text: Visited Cyclo on Friday night with a party of 7 and mmmmmmmm......mmmmmmmmm....it was delish!! Justine was the perfect host and of course, love the fact that it is BYOB without a corkage fee!  We turned our evening over to sweet Justine and she did not disappoint! Everything was wonderful....spare ribs, spring rolls (love the grilled pork), green beans and the yummy egg crepe! Really good!  For our entrees, we shared a number of outstanding dishes! Plus the food just coming and coming! It was a great way to try so many different options! To top off our feast, we ended with amazing Vietnamese coffee (seriously wish she would open a coffee shop - it's that good!) and a Thai Ice Tea! Refreshing, fabulous and I seriously could have had 4 more!!  Because it is not the largest location, be prepared to wait, but it is definitely worth it! Can't wait to make the hike down to C-town again to get my pho on!!

DFpu6agM78ef13bEHkMLBw.text: I only got here once and meant to get back before I left town but just never made it.  I had the pho at the recommendation of my waitress and she was right--it was delicious!  I will definitely try to go again next time I am in town!

0DAFR9mNb-otywk3CbbdOA.text: Great when lovely owner Justina is there, but when she's not -- beware.  Normally, food is explosively flavorful and service is warm and attentive. Went recently on an owner-free Saturday. Employees tried to close early, poured us the last of our BYO (about 25 minutes after we'd arrived and wolfed our food), then screamed at us to leave.   I don't know if this is biz-as-usual, but it's not worth another trip to find out.

w0nesbODiWJd8AieQMrmWQ.text: I have to agree with everyone who commented on Justina.  She is hysterical.  The first time we where there she forced me to eat my meal with chopsticks.  She has a very dry sense of humor.  Our favorite item is actually an appetizer -- the pork spare ribs.  They fall off the bone.  The chow fun is also great.    The only drawbacks are the limited menu and lack of alcohol.  They do let you bring your own alcohol with no corkage.  The place has been full every time I've been there.  There are probably about 15 tables in total so get there early!

vXULJHjZdHmefR1Qa4SFHQ.text: This place is so incredibly good. Hubby and I went the other day for lunch and even though this was not our first time, I realized that I hadn't reviewed them yet so here goes.  Ambiance - It is a small place that is clean and open and comfortable. Even though it is on the small side it does not feel cramped. It is tastefully decorated and not kitschy like some Vietnamese restaurants can be.  Service - Our server was very sweet. She was available to answer questions, but didn't hover. She recommended the baby coconuts to drink with our meal since it is hella hot AZ summertime. We heard her helping the table next to us that had all kinds of special requests (ugh).  Food - SO YUMMY! I cannot go here and not order the spring rolls with shrimp so we split an order of those and they were as good as I remembered them being. The peanut sauce that comes with them is not too sweet and they were just right.  He ordered the lemon chicken because he can't not order their lemon chicken and it is so so so good. If you haven't had it yet then try it. We love it. I ordered Pad Thai - I know, Thai food at a Vietnamese place, but I couldn't help it, I was feeling noodle-y. It was definitely their own personal take on it, but I really loved it.  And those baby coconuts that the server recommended? HOLY COW. They were absolutely mind blowingly amazing. So delicious!  We will definitely be back again and again and again and again......

teRF98bpxGzvxYpcHs46nQ.text: Out of most of menu items  Probable not going back very limited options  Food was decent The service was fast

MG9ykgcjiE6j55D0pglDlA.text: I am in Chandler for business travel and was craving Pho.  I found this place and wow!  The service was absolutely amazing.  They even customized my pho for me.  The shrimp pho was the best I've had.  The spicy green beans were also very good.   They were really friendly and fast.  This place is wonderful and I will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Love the vibe and service here!

VjZ-0Rd8mAXDMJRQRD-R_g.text: I read the good reviews on yelp and thought I'd stop by for lunch. We had the black pepper shrimp which came on crostini style bread (but not toasted) - flavor was good but I'm not sure the purpose of the bread. I had the green papaya salad which was pretty decent; not the best but not bad. My colleague ordered the pineapple curry and if I had to explain it, it seemed like they threw a packet of curry flavoring in with way too much rice and added way to much water - very bland. To make up for this we decided to order the lemongrass chicken and I can't say that really helped. It had better flavor but honestly tasted like it was made yesterday.   Did we order the wrong things? Maybe. But being from the Bay Area I've had some pretty awesome Vietnamese food and this just isn't up to standard. Sad day:(

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. papaya salad
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Black pepper shrimp

UnF17mxf-MD_IDzVLnDObg.text: This is a quaint yet quality place to get pho. There wasn't A vegetarian option on the menu for pho but we ended up asking and they made a beautiful soup with a vegetarian broth. I think there was more variety of vegetables in this soup then I've ever gotten in any restaurant in Arizona. The fresh spring rolls could've been filled with more herbs, but I will say upon request we got another plate of herbs for our soup. It was one of the best I've found. (Especially good for Vegans.)  The owner was very friendly. She came around and visited with everybody. She let us know that her boyfriend made all the decor which was quite modern. I'll most definitely return when I swing by here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Inside decor.
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Loaded veggie vegan pho.
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Beautiful fruit infused water.

rEUE6B02x3cdle9JghLnpg.text: Had to stop by chandler mall today to grab some stuff and my husband found this place. Since the weather has been chilly lately we decided to stop by and try some of their food.. we ordered egg rolls, mint chicken along with lemon grass chicken and small bowl beef pho which the waitress (owner?) said we were able to order bc she knew I was torn between pho and the chicken.. the pho was decent and both of chicken dishes were pretty good.. the only thing we are taking couple pts off is that it was little pricey then ur usual pho but other then that we will probably be back to try other things on their menu.. also the menu here is very limited to your other Vietnamese restaurants..

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States

z5hOYLmKbAwvXvzWyC_rVQ.text: Been coming here for a couple years, and this place never lets me down.  The owner is super friendly and the place is always clean.  The spicy garlic green beans are amazing, a must.  I always get the pho and it's really good but I am excited to try some of the other dishes.    Also I sampled some of the Kombucha. I'm normally not much of a fan of Kombucha but I really enjoyed the Belgian waffle and the Hazelnut flavors.   I'll be back soon.

qChh4AHudKIGXzbYbVy97w.text: Cyclo has a really nice clean atmosphere with really good food.  It starts off at the front door with the nice lady (owner?) who is warm and welcoming.  If you ever talk to her, you will see that her personality is quite funny!   The menu is simple and straight forward with mostly traditional Vietnamese dishes including Pho.  I went for the beef pho and was not disappointed.  The portions are very large as well.  Also, no need to order drinks here as their regular water is infused with fruit.  You have to try it for yourself but that is probably the most memorable thing about this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. The beef pho
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Fruity water, a nice touch

8LuxOqZQCXp8xv2dBlGHCQ.text: Nothing better then a classic pho on a cold, snowy day. Yes it snowing right now in Phoenix! Very nice service

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pho

m1ln2qIUSCJyXDI72N28mg.text: This is my favorite place to get Vietnamese food in town. We got the Pho Ap Chao and Com Tam, with sticky rice and mango for dessert. Food tastes fresh and super authentic, and the presentation is beautiful. The service is fast and friendly!

kWHsUtLwIyqwC0CicwfXpQ.text: So I'm waiting for my tire to get fixed, an hour and a half and it's dinner time. I walk over to Cyclo to check it out. It's cold and a nice bowl of Pho is in order. The lady at the front makes me feel like a regular, she is friendly and welcoming. The water they bring me has apple orange and pomegranate. I order the pho ga--the bowl is bigger than my head. It it delicious! Tucked away, but a delightful experience!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States

wocJLVa8SmE4sl4AHP0Qkg.text: This is a place I will be returning to again and again. The casual atmosphere and BYOB system makes it a great place to sit and chat for dinner.  I ordered pho and banh xeo, and everything tasted exactly like I thought it would; memories of dinners at home in California came flooding back to me.  The water comes with cutely sliced fruit inside, service is attentive and friendly, and the furniture is modern and great to look at. Highly recommended!

1Izq_Gr6BKwJwsGAq5Gm_Q.text: Awesome food, great decor and the proprietor is wonderful! Had the crab and shrimp soup, delicious! Don't forget to try the crafted kombucha!

J_gd1_go7A0UW5eHXijY9g.text: Delicious food, fresh in-house kombuchas... SO good they are a MUST TRY!   AND the BEST water experience EVER.  Clean your palette and your chakras with this enlightened menu and experience!  You must meet the owner!! Out of this world cool and genuinely amazing woman!  An awesome experience for a romantic, modern evening!

KbCFdUoKOpcdq-zSajw9Ow.text: This place came highly recommended to us by friends so we had to cheack it out now we go here every week. The owner now knows our order by heart. Pho and egg rolls are to die for I once got a take out of 12 eggs rolls for dinner  The owner is really nice she thought me how to use chopsticks now I'm a pro. Even the water is great infused with cute little fruit pieces. Highly reccomend the pho in the event of a hangover or a cold/flu.

NdNSMO9E5k5P5exdQoFOZw.text: Decor: great Staff: owner/hostess Vibe: exceptional  BYOB: a plus if you are on a wine budget Pho: THE WORST.  I had packaged  pho ( similar to ramen) that tasted better.

bC4ZPrWUmxHxLqCNZAUglQ.text: Awesome.. food was great, service was great, prices very fare and teasing from owner Justine was free if she likes you..you can bring your own drinks too!! We'll be going back often

P2xc7WIbNGZlBmZafrogYw.text: This has been our favorite Chandler/Tempe restaurant for decades. The food is terrific (even the water is special, with fruit mixing with the ice in the pitcher), and the prices are low; you can have a feast for so little. I also like their BYOB policy, because we can bring a bottle of wine with no corkage fee, so we end up having paid (for a bottle of wine) about the same as a glass of wine would cost at other restaurants. Some of our favorite dishes (for 2 people):  we start by sharing an order of spicy green beans and fresh summer spring rolls, then each of us order one of the great main dishes, and then we end by sharing a mango rice dessert.  News flash: the outgoing former owner recently sold Cyclo. We know the new owners (they are so nice) from their shop in Tempe, Lee's Tailoring. They have astutely kept the same great kitchen staff, menu, and recipes. They even had the amazing home-made kombucha on hand (we had the blood orange flavor). This place rocks!

n6iIqTY-tpuMCVQFFC5ivA.text: Amazing service, atmosphere and food! They focus on all your senses. It's a complete dining experience with great music, lighting, and artwork. The vegan pho is incredible, with a rich broth and vegetables that you don't often see, like mushrooms. The water comes infused with a mix of fresh fruit. It's BYOB, which only adds ti the atmosphere and the personalized nature of their service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States

M6DRZIV86HqrL0pk1IwCzg.text: Me and my wifey love this place!! There are so many thoughtful touches to the meal and experience from the artwork, the charming hostess, the fruit water, fresh flowers, bring your own bottle policy, and oh by the way, the food!! You can't find better crispy rice noodles in the valley!

eTbCuyxNM6X_E_XMfVDnWw.text: Very Americanized restaurant! Service was fine, but I didn't feel comfortable enjoying food. The spring rolls came out as a big disappointment to me, it was even smaller than my 2 fingers! I didn't order the Pho, but I came up with Papaya salad which was also a waste: too sour (too much lime juice) and not even tasty!  I'd prefer more authentic Vietnamese restaurant with decent prices! This probably is a suitable place for Americans, but I'm sorry, not for me! I'd prefer Pho All Seasons or Pho Ao Sen - much better!  Well, gotta try it at least once anyway!

OFcqsnvB2zls7gRTOiLimw.text: I would give this place two out of five stars. The service was so so and the prices were a little high for Pho. It was ok but don't plan on going back.

h8mMgscn2Ee29Kxuy4Fb7Q.text: Always a great time! Food is good and everyone is fun. If you don't want to have fun, you can try Panda Express and be boring.

5nkMhwfQTKaTUE1FyOwg9w.text: Read al lthe hype, so decided to give Cyclo a try.  What a disappointment!  Portions were small and overpriced, owner thinks she's the next best thing to sliced bread.  She needs to go back to Vietnam to remember how real Vietnamese food is prepared.  Give this place a miss.

Cb-1wxQ1ETkXNr0o20alpw.text: What the pho, man?!  The food is bland.  It tastes like they cater to the elderly.  The prices are high for the type of food you are getting.  Nobody should have to bay over $5.75 for ANY type of pho.    I've gone there 2x and I don't know if it's just me, but the hostess there just rubbed me the wrong way both times.  She was cracking jokes and making comments that were borderline inappropriate.    They focus more on decor and trying to "entertain" their patrons rather than focusing on what's really important... the food.  You want a really good, AUTHENTIC bowl of Pho?  Go to Saigon Pho on Alma School/Knox.  It's not as ritzy and refined, but the pho and other menu items there are less expensive, tastes better, and they serve you much larger portions.    Eat at Cyclo if you want to have a SEEMINGLY over-attentive hostess bothering you while you try to eat.  (I say "seemingly" because while you may think she's over-attentive, in reality, she hasn't even done as much as refill your water glass.)

NzSvfi6qO_ZRoQSk5NZNYA.text: Why is this listed far away from its actual location. I can't seem to be able to check in here  Pros: Ambiance, Small Establishment (mom and popish... something I support)  Cons: Probably everything else.  This is my 5th time visiting this place and the only reason for it has been its proximity. The service has always been shoddy (subjective). I guess you have to be a regular or catch the owners eye to be given any sort of good service. As for me I got the "don't care for you" service ( even though only 4 tables were occupied during the lunch hour). I guess I must be becoming invisible.  Food: Saw the prices and was a bit surprised (asian upper class restaurant?? somewhat of an anomaly, easily double of what you get in other Vietnamese restaurants. Thought to myself the food better rock for these prices). Ordered the mint chicken, what I got was a well decorated but bland and not seasoned dish. I had to put in heaps of fish sauce and oyster sauce just to make it palatable.   What a waste of good earned cash and a bad aftertaste to boot. Hopefully in future this review will remind me never to visit this place again.

9NW-G-3F6gLFLB5_FTJnAQ.text: I like the atmosphere. And the server lady is great. But, I had the pho which was good, however loaded with msg - to the point I had a wicked msg hangover for hours afterward. Massive headache, sick stomach- like the worst hangover for a few hours post. I won't be eating here again because of this, unfortunately. If the food wasn't loaded with msg I'd eat here again.

5ADAkJT9M2Z8mMPZ1nG0cQ.text: I cannot believe it has taken me this long to write a review for Justina Duong's wonderful Cyclo Vietnames Cuisine.  We visited Cyclo for the first time on the first Friday after a very positive review by the Arizona Republic food critic Howard Seftel.  The small place was slammed.  Being a woman of action, I stepped in and helped by being the "hostess" and taking down names for a waiting list.  Guess that helped me become friends with the acerbic but deep down sweet woman that is Justina Duong.  You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Spring rolls are compact but full of all sorts of meat and veggies.  Bun Hanoi and Bun Saigon are tasty treats full of fresh herbs and vegetables.  My husband loves this lemon chicken curry dish that to me smells like Lemon Pledge, but he gets it each time.   the beef pho is full of flavor and comes with a mound of salad, unlike some of the other "cheaper" pho shops nearby.    i can't imagine anyone has complaints with the food at Cyclo.  If they do, it is probably that their judgment is clouded as they came on a Friday and Saturday night at 7 p.m. to a 14 table establishment and expected to be served immediately and be fawned after.  If you are this needy, don't come here and take up a table...we're waiting patiently to be served. :)

UhU2EDUFylOrhE7hWRstng.text: Ate here twice and was just became more disappointed. The first time I ate here was probably 3 months ago, an old guy served us, he was okay, there were no people inside even it's lunch time. The food was ordinary, but pricey. Like 12 bucks a pho. I would've gone to Saigon Pho if I wanted cheaper, or to Unphogettable or Chandler Pho if I wanna pay extra but have decently flavored food. The atmosphere is modern. Clean. The second time I had To Go and this lady server (I'm assuming owner, hear me out why), was extremely loud and annoying, touching customers in unnecessary ways like patting the back while eating. She was dancing and really was all over the place (I'm thinking a bit drunk). Anyway, no, I will not come back anymore. I have no idea why people visit this place. It's either they don't know a much better Viet cuisine or they have no choice.

QJAdiic2jD_IQFVmluz3-w.text: I don't know why it has taken me forever and a day to write a review about this place... but it was the first vietnamese resteraunt we went to in Arizona. Since we came from the bay area, this place had a big shoes to fill.  Pretty small place, the simple decorations are nice (or it was about 2 years ago). Selection of food isn't as big as some other Vietnamese places around here, but definitely higher-priced pho than most places. It's $9-$12 for a bowl of pho, a bit pricey much? I guess I'm more used to $7-8 for a bowl.   This was the first time I've ever been to a pho place and seen the owner dressed up like she's ready to walk down New York Fashion Week. I mean, she's nice and everything, but a little flashy for me. Not sure if I'd like my food to be prepared by someone wearing a mini skirt? I mean, assuming she's helping out in the kitchen and everything. But she does run the food back and forth. Almost makes me think that the high prices of the food are to support her fashion/makeup fetish. Eh.  I really can't complain about the food, but I do have a gripe with the pricing. Authentic Vietnamese food should be priced accordingly.

47HNlClGAIRqv4IVy5qiNQ.text: Love this place. Food and service is top notch. Priced right and food that makes me come back over and over. Try the short ribs and green beans and you won't go wrong. Don't forget to bring your own wine.

cJhpZ5tU99P3gznyxem00Q.text: The 3 rating is purely based on the food itself, which was okay. I don't think there was much of service available. We went on a slow night, so can't say the restaurant was brimming with people. They kept the door open, and that let insects inside. I even saw some flying insects disturbing us while eating. The lady at the counter was doing everything, taking order, taking payments, serving which was causing unnecessary delays. Coming to the food, lemongrass chicken was served dry to be eaten with rice without any fish sauce, haven't seen this in any other Vietnamese restaurant. The other guy who was serving did not understand English well, as when we asked for fish sauce from this guy, nothing came out. After dinner, we were made to wait for 10+ minutes for desert, and was asked if were in any hurry when we checked with the lady about when we are going to get the dessert. The communication of the restaurant staff with customers leaves a lot to be expected, so is the service. I think there are better Vietnamese and Asian fusion places in town.

9KRks-OQo-P3oQBKIKkPPA.text: Love the Pho and Justine. I want her to be my stylist but apparently she's a bit busy. Fine I'll just have the Pho.

o6BBQozBjNuY-WOu-7M4PQ.text: This is my second favorite Restaurant in Phoenix (behind only Tarbell's) and receives consistently Phabulous reviews. I have had much on their menu and have loved almost ALL.   I have become a "Pho Aficionado" and I love the strong flavors in the best Phos. Cyclo's Pho leaves a lot to be desired! Broth is generally too thin, although the service is beautifully done. Plus their Pho is expensive when compared to other "Pho Joints" that I believe have better Pho.  Everything else I have eaten on their menu (and I have eaten most everything!) is indeed PHABULOUS, so I will just go elsewhere for my Pho Phix! Besides, I would miss NOT seeing Justina (Cyclo Owner) who is a delightful experience, not to mention the delightful experiences available on their menu, other than the Pho!!

pqADmTsKb5D6zFl219GZqA.text: The Pho Tai was terrible...the broth was oily & the meat was fatty.  Not just a little bit of fat, but globs of floppy nasty fat.  I have never had to pull the meat out of my pho.  This excess amount of fat was gross (and I'm not even usually picky about fat).  We've had a lot of pho, but never something this bad.  I really wanted to like this place.  The decor is cute...all Ikea furniture and cool art on the walls.  They played pop music.  Service was friendly and the place appears to be family owned.  Our egg rolls were good, but we only got 3 and most places usually serve 6.   The price was ridiculous!  We ordered our usual...2 bowls of pho thai (1 large & 1 small), 2 drinks, and an order of egg rolls.  Most places we've ever ate at charge between $20-$25.  For this nasty meal...we paid $34!    We won't be returning.

-AlSvMxU66qDJOkLzN63PA.text: Awesome service. Try the beef chow fun and spicy garlic green beans, they are amazing.

n1lof_XwBX5nbfoMzdehQA.text: Super yummy, cool ambiance. I had the Bun Sai Gon and it was SO GOOD. Can't wait to go back!!!

oueIe27N9Z71DcXeTxO8Hg.text: Still of fan of both Justina and the food at Cyclo.  Crisp rice noodle cake is great, the the green beans and pho are excellent too.  Justina could not be nicer to my kids, and she is always ready to laugh.  For those with kids, the chicken noodle soup and green beans are both big hits.

04gARTDZQaipK4G2I50Zzg.text: Let's play chicken.  Lots of chicken on the Cyclo menu, which based upon my experience at other Vietnamese places apparently isn't very typical Vietnamese...and dang it I'm allergic to chicken so I notice and dislike heavily chicken-biased menus.  Of all the meat and rice dishes only one is not chicken.  We ordered the spring rolls with pork and shrimp - very nice, though I would have preferred fish sauce over peanut sauce.  Next was beef pho.  Also decent but nothing to make me drive all the way to Chandler (I was passing through today).  it was a good meal, and it looks like there are some other interesting items on the very small-ish menu, but I really don't understand all the fuss about this place.  What did Seftel see in it that I don't ?  Of course Seftel thinks Yelp is one of the worst ideas of the last decade so my faith in him is slowly being shaken....  Cyclo doesn't shake a stick at Da Vang or the long lost Pho Loc....

yrzmL7DwXqR_ODtDnKqdQA.text: Damn all of you who rave about this place.  I live like 2 mintues from Cyclo and have been wanting to try it for a couple years now.  So my son and I went last night for a little date :o)  We came in and had to use the resetroom first... then were told that we could sit anywhere... so we did, well then we just sat there for like 5 minutes with no menu, no drink order, NOTHING... our waiter was sitting at the table next to us EATING... that's fucking awesome, you take your time, we're not here to dine or anything!  Finally he gives us a menu... takes another snack break with his gramma or whoever?  and some lady with a sour face, maybe his aunt?  finally takes our drink order.  I had the Thai Iced Tea, which wasn't that great... first of all it was ORANGE... never had it this color before and I've had a fair share (cept the one at Saigon Pho was orange too, vietnamese thing???).  I could've ignored the color if the taste was better... we didnt get straws, but then our waiter disappeared for a while and brought back straws from walgreens... without a wrapper on it... DO I REALLY WANT TO USE THE STRAW YOU JUST HAD YOUR DIRTY ASS HANDS ON??  So by this time, I'm thinking we should have just gone to Chino Bandido on the other side of the parking lot.  He finally comes back to take our order, we had the Chicken Wings for an appetizer and decided to share the Pad Thai.  Our wings arrived fairly quickly... they were actually tasty and pretty spicy.  The only thing I didn't really enjoy were the ton of seeds... just not a great mouth feel.  Now something happened that really bugs the crap outta me.  We JUST GOT our wings and had barely taken a couple bites when our entree arrived.  Dont they know about timing?  I dont want my entree yet, I know it might sound picky, but I would really like to enjoy my appetizer and not feel rushed because I dont want my entree to get cold.  Sorry... I know I'm ranting...  So we finished a wing and decided to start on the Pad Thai, which, even though we tried to hurry to it, was kinda cold now, and the noodles were all congealed together in a big lump-o-noodle. The flavor was good, I liked the shrimp in it too, but Dom and I agreed that the chunks of egg were "weird".  I prefer little shreds of egg and I also prefer it to be served on a plate rather than a bowl so that the "gravy" keeps the noodles mosty separated instead of in a noodle ball.  Oh, and this version was made with very thin noodles, I prefer the wide noodle for this dish.  Maybe I'm being picky, but that's my right as a patron I guess.  So we kinda picked some more at our food and then Dom had to use the restroom... so he did his thing, and I waited for the bill which took another little while to come even though there were only two other tables occupied.   Overall, I thought the food was ok, nothing spectacular at all though.  I guess I really had high expectations for Cyclo  - and that mixed with the poor service (just lacked any personality , friendliness, or attentiveness), I just felt let down.  I'll give it another chance in the hopes that the service is better, and perhaps the owner will be there to liven things up?

CRIA1YLguotEMqZrLg3GZQ.text: Service, food, decor and again....food, all top notch.  My only complaint is I didnt know of it sooner.  I'll be back weekly.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Yummm, sticky rice with mango
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Decor is cool and modern

THFNbaLN0qfI6PioEX27cg.text: This is the best restaurant, not just Vietnamese restaurant, but restaurant of any kind I've been to in a long time! I'm a bit of a restaurant snob from living in an area that is full of Valley treasures - Postino, the Vig, La Grande Orange, Chelsea's Kitchen, etc. we thoroughly enjoyed the pho, sticky rice with mango, and jasmine tea. The pho broth was delicious, the meat was very thinly sliced, too! The service was fast and the owner worked the room beautifully! People were at the tables leaning over and being friendly, telling us how much they love the place. The decor is so fun and artistic! Cute little cyclo riding skellies sit atop a mango red-orange wall and oil paintings adorn another. The owner was adorable with my boyfriend's three year old son - he was most welcome at Cyclo. We'll be back again and again!

DlO4hjlv_Dt09wecQqgEWw.text: Absolutely amazing food! I recommend the papaya salad, garlic green beans, black pepper shrimp, beef chow fun and the lemongrass chicken. Your experience is bound to be unique if Justine, the owner is working. She is fabulous and memorable to say the least. The best part is it is byob so your check is reasonable. Why haven't you tried his place yet?

2N0MMhLlgbAyHtBK_hA_Qw.text: Food was good! Lemonade was excellent! And the owner is spunky and interactive! Can't go wrong with whatever you order!

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mango and sticky rice
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pho with sirloin and pineapple chicken curry
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Crispy Crepe

HukNwyx1ckz299c_xmJFBA.text: Everything about this place is right on when you walk through the door. The food is incredible. The variety and selection is great. Every dish makes you want to order another one just to experience the incredible flavors of the spices and herbs. The owner is awesome and so attentive and makes you want to keep coming back for more.

QG2i0PlMNw_A5YB2aegpuw.text: Cyclo has been around a LONG time, we went today for the first time in a while, and I am kicking myself for waiting too long.  EXCELLENT food, GREAT, FUN service, we will be back later this week!

dUy90Qj2eufEE_VAuqC-Fg.text: The food is just ok.  I do like the fruit water.  There are better places in the area.  I will not return.

U4sWHCtOeZMyEQJH4_xqxw.text: Vegan, vegetarian and pescan friendly! By the gods it has amazing pho! The decor and music are hip and stylish. At night the low lighting with the festive lights is almost creepy. The people are friendly and most speak enough English to understand complex orders. My only complaint was that bean sprouts were not offered. The cilantro served was for one person not two. The limes and jalapeno were sufficient however. I always want more basil/mint but I'm just picky. Been to three pho places tonight. I'm glad one was friendly enough to serve all. A great restaurant. Although pricier than the rest. Worth every cent.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cute decor

09d59_cVsfEYziZg0fsiYA.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a while now because of all the Yelp reviews but when we went there for dinner last night I wasn't that impressed. Maybe because my expectations were too high. We started with the pork spare ribs which had a really yummy sauce on them. But the sauce was a little too thin and didn't really adhere to the meat and the ribs themselves were chopped up into bite sized pieces which made them somewhat difficult to eat. I ordered beef pho for my entree and of course it was delicious (Is it possible to have bad pho?) but I found that the broth had less flavor to it than other places I've tried. Like some spices were missing or something. My hubby ordered the mixed grill with rice and he was pretty happy since it came with a lot of meat. We also split the flan for dessert and it wasn't anything special. The fun and funky decor was cool but I found the plastic chairs to be pretty uncomfortable.  I thought that the prices were pretty reasonable. We spent $35 for a fairly large amount of food. I am surprised by some of the other reviews that said Cyclo is too expensive. Who says authentic Asian food has to be dirt cheap? The owner has created a cute little trendy restaurant with a loyal following (we saw lots of regulars greeted warmly) and so she can charge a little more than your average strip mall dive.  In summary, I enjoyed my experience here but was not overly impressed with the food. I might come back if I was in the neighborhood but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

F7kncP3AqLI_LCqtCrbXUQ.text: we had vegetable rolls, pho, green papaya salad, chicken curry, and fried rice.  I have had vietnamese food all over the country and this is some of the best. The only is extremely helpful.

hi42eYunxjZpKmXONM11fw.text: Some friends of ours had been trying to convince us to come to Cyclo (pronounced SICK-lo) for a couple of months, and I'm so glad we did. All the food was fresh, and very authentic, according to our friend who has been to Vietnam. The spicy green beans were amazing, I could eat them like french fries. I had the pad thai with tofu for my entree and it was SO GOOD! The noodles tasted freshly made, the tofu was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the sauce was not overly peanutty or overpowering. My hubby had a giant bowl of pho soup, which he thoroughly enjoyed. I liked that they had so many vegetarian options.   As for the ambiance, I really enjoyed it. The lighting, decor and music was happy and modern. We met the owner, Justine, and I was actually scared to meet her based on the previous reviews I had read on Yelp. Well, turns out the reviews couldn't have been more wrong. She is sweet and personable and she lightheartedly joked with our table. She gracefully floated throughout the tables the whole night, making people laugh and making sure they were taken care of. In my opinion, more owners should be this way, because it shows that they really care about their customers and their experience. BOTTOMLINE: I will definitely come back!

nK6_czlzsC0gdh4OVS7QnQ.text: Hmmmmmmmmmm  First, lets get the food out of the way - it was ok. I ordered the pad thai and have had better. There were -only five baby shrimp in the whole bowl! It wasn't bad, but for the price, it should have been fantastic.  Ambiance: hopefully, what we experienced was not the norm for this place. With all the f-bombs and unimaginative cussing from the painfully drunk table next to us AND the owner (she had to be the owner. I cant imagine an employee getting away with that.) it felt as if we had walked into a Quentin Tarrentino movie. I expected to see Christoph Waltz sitting across the room.   My sister had a headache when we arrived and it was only intensified by the forty year old frat boys. After awhile she wanted to ram her fist down their beer holes. Of course, that should have very little to do with the rating but, the fact that they were being encouraged by the establishment, does. Bad first impression.

eW72nvp2nUW7N0sZnoI3vg.text: Best Pho Ga I've had in Arizona .  Very accommodating to leave off items that I can't have. My favorite broth by far. I seriously have There Oho Ga at least once a week for the past year.  Justina is a hoot!  I appreciate her sassy but non offensive attitude. She cracks me up.

_ct9XqUUvwQ7Oi3ne_8GCQ.text: Delicious yet again! Pho, garlic green beans, papaya salad...they can do no dish wrong. The owner, Justina, is hip, cool, gorgeous and awesome! It's BYOB so bring a nice wine or beer...no corking fee so don't forget to tip well!  If you're eating and there's a big line of others waiting, please do what we do and go across the street to gelato so that other people don't have to wait an hour.

CtwOuJSIV1VmIA1IhcmrAw.text: I'm not a big fan of vietnamese food but I have found several tasty options in my travels. This restaurant had some of the best entrees I have had in a long time. It was plentiful and extremley good.   This did not help the location and decor. When you go somewhere that is trying too hard to be trendy there are some expectations. The plastic seats made it feel like I was at a Burger King. That made me feel like I was over paying even though the food was real good. I would go back for the food but the sad truth is as good as the food is, I would want a better environment.

ZjPgvPeZbTMNk1UKsZYZ7w.text: PHOreal the best Pho in town. I can always tell when good is made with love. The energy of the place and food is absolutely incredible. The infused water is above and beyond. If you are in the area or from the other side of town (like myself) I would highly suggest getting your butt here. the menu is also very simple, which I like. There isn't 453 items on the menu. Where else can you go where the owner of the place is constantly there insuring quality and service. Overall Cyclo is PHOnominal!!!!

U8WFrdP56jrjcqpFowNPCw.text: The staff, service and food are AMAZING! The atmosphere is modern and no- frills nice. The seating is limited, be prepared to wait for a seat or take it to go if you hit during M-F lunch rush, but whatever you do, don't bail...this is a great dining experience. The spicy garlic beans are delectable!

3VAFhfLzKbnfpuzKCc3AMw.text: Stopped by here to have lunch since it was really close to work. I love the upbeat personality of the owner. The service was great and everything was "good looking" and apetizing. Even the free fruit water that I was given was fancy with lemon and watermelons. The service was fast and I did not wait long for my food considering I only had an hour for lunch. I also noticed that a lot of the guests were regulars and that the owner had established good relationships with them. Looking forward to eating here again when I am back in the area since I have changed jobs.

YMIrOKKdx2o-8SDT31fRvw.text: What a fun place! I had the spicy beef salad that was delicious and spicy. My husband had  a rice dish with shrimp and beef that he really enjoyed. I added some of his rice to mine to make a perfect dish for me. We will definitely be back. Thank you!

cQWvd_Eq-ZLsJ7OrCcJsRQ.text: The first thing you will notice here is Justina. She is warm, friendly, and, if you show up alone, she will sit at your table and get to know you. I had never had Vietnamese food before, so couldn't tell what to order. Her recommendations were the Vietnamese egg roll, Spring roll, and the Black Pepper Shrimp with garlic toast. The first two were good. Although, my pallet did need to get used to the Spring roll, because I did not expect it to be a cool dish, I thought it was delicious.  My favorite? The black pepper shrimp. It had the perfect spicing between the garlic on the bread and a little bit of cilantro, I definitely wanted more.  Highly Recommended!!!

5QihjLyASX_gbvw0c64xUA.text: This place was EXCELLENT! Beautiful ambiance from the cool decorations to the fresh flowers.  Pho totally exceeded my expectations.

-nKQjzK-ISmY-qcaLOQ-kw.text: Absolutely our Favorite Vietnamese food in the Valley! Justina is such a fantastic owner and hostess.  Love our fun conversations.

hiLVJmOI_9dRz1zVH1CJrA.text: Great pho! The service is excellent and you are well taken care of. However the owner swears more than most sailors I know, so don't bring anyone here with any hope of a formal or decent atmosphere.  This place definitely does not meet the standard Vietnamese restaurant stereotype: VERY trendy (looks like an Ikea truck threw up in there). Can't take dates or family here due to the atmosphere. Pho is worth the trip, however and Justina -- whom I like to call Sailor Mouth -- is the price of admission!

xIzfUaI6mkpd5vRQLbFezg.text: I was worried when we initially came in that the restaurant would be big on ambience and small on flavor or authenticity. It's a very cool looking restaurant, but I've noticed that often a cool atmosphere results in mediocre food. Not so here. Their veggie spring rolls are amazing, and the peanut sauce that comes with them is phenomenal. On our second trip, we got a double order. :) The Pho Hai San is some of the best pho I've ever had, with whole, peeled shrimp, scallops, and crab legs IN THE SHELL so you know you're getting the real deal and not imitation crab. My husband has gotten the Pho Ga and Pho Tai and raved about both. Even the complimentary water, with huge slices of fresh fruit in it, is great. We can't wait to go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Even the water is pretty!
Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pho Hai San

uRXqKbaVxJZZDVv7nLUmMA.text: We should have been tipped off by the overall Caucasian-invasion that made up the patrons.  When you are in a new city, you want to know where the "locals" go.  Same applies to cuisine.  If I've offended my fellow Caucasoids, I do apologize.  Many of you do know good food regardless of ethnicity.  The folks dining at Cyclo on the regular, clearly do not.  While the decor was funky and trendy, it felt more like a hair salon than a restaurant and the clear plastic chairs were not particularly comfortable.    We ordered two appetizers:  egg rolls and pork short ribs.  The egg rolls were good, I will say, but the pork was incredibly fatty and hard to eat off the bone.  Our entrees were two types of Rice Vermicelli:  Hanoi and Saigon.  Wholly underwhelming and WAY overpriced.  We didn't even bother with the pho at $9-$12 per bowl!  They likely mark up the soup to pay for the real hydrangeas on the tables.  Nice touch, but I'd rather have good, inexpensive soup which I can get literally anywhere in those parts.  Lastly, what is the deal with the infused water?  Lemon or lime I can tolerate--Phoenix Metro isn't known for it's delicious drinking water.  But cucumber and strawberry and something else I could not place is forcing flavors on everyone who just wants hydration.  It's water.  Try not to over think it.

oVRoAjDV2w1BpxVCkVI4mQ.text: First time at Cyclo. Came highly recommended from multiple friends. Everything we ordered was amazing from the short ribs, spicy chicken wings, green papaya salad and the Pho. Justina is hilarious and I will be back at least once a week so she can give me a hard time!!!

ylsIud5Xql6adS4F4zdOTQ.text: Super amazing food!  We had the green papaya salad, rice crepe, wokked beef, fried rice, crispy rice cake.  The crepe was out of this world!  The rice cake was also delicious.  The staff was so friendly.  We will be back!

Rjm_p_9RtZ6ljkyL7a6p5g.text: Cyclo is like the cooler, hip younger sister restaurant of Khai Hoan in Tempe (They are literally sister restaurants, as stated on their menu).  It exudes the exuberance of youth, but doesn't quite capture the authenticity and depth of menu that Khai Hoan does.  The interior is similar to a funky little boba shop, with lots of bright, pop-star colors and design, and those that are unfamiliar with Vietnamese cuisine may find this as a good stepping stone.  The menu is very limited, and portions are smaller than Khai Hoan, albeit more fancifully decorated with flair.  Prices are also higher.  The papaya salad I had was good, and had a good balance of tangy, spicy, and sweet.  My husband's mixed grill entree was decent, but the strips of meat were slightly overcooked so they tasted tough.  Justine, the owner, was here and she is charming, vibrant, and always has a funny story to tell.  I do give her props for creating a more welcoming atmosphere for those that are usually afraid to try different foods, but for me, I'll probably head to Khai Hoan for my Vietnamese fix.

2KdV78u_eKRb5DvETJLsYQ.text: Everything about this restaurant is amazing! The decor and food is fantastic and the owner is fabulous - love her!   We sampled quite a few things and while I loved it all, my favorite was the beef salad. Can't wait to go back!

JURZs4UBctVjqkSjyNPrrg.text: This place ROCKS! Justina love ya girl! Outstanding food, outstanding service, great atmosphere. Trust me... you gotta try this place! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cyclo Vietnamese Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Date night with the kiddos :)

xT7M5dtfcXjP8xTm_Q20iA.text: I love pho. This place was pretty good. I like the vibe and decorations in this place.

VoEFx1BZwjl6yri2jzy8Ng.text: Lunch out today with a group of former coworkers, and we decided on Cyclo. Two of us had been before and loved it. Justina is always so funny and entertaining. Decor is modern. Today, I decided to try the lemongrass chicken, and was it ever good. =) I do wish that I had ordered a side of the green beans, as another table had them and they looked delish. We will certainly be back.   I also really loved the addition of fruit to the water. It made it taste fresh like the food.   Great job Justina! Keep it up.

oKhVA85MGpjYie7ZowwJ1A.text: Wasn't a fan of the food and was even less of a fan of the service. She was nice, but inattentive. I had the Mi Ga and my girlfriend had the Seafood Pho. For what it's worth, she would give 3 stars.

vcszRuqWr6e0NIsFUWZOlQ.text: Excellent Pho here, I've been to many different Vietnamese restaurants in the area and Cyclo Pho is one of the best. The atmosphere is cozy and nice and the staff there are all friendly and amazing. One of my go-to places for awesome soup. Gotta have the XL Chicken Pho!

6cfBl0krUAzxladnuobbdA.text: A bit disappointing. I eat Thai, Chinese, Vietnamese cuisine 4 days a week. This placed look good and received 4 stars. Tempting. Unfortunately, no lunch special. Ordered crispy lemongrass chicken. It was good not great. What made me truly disappointed and surprised, was how it was served. Not one veggie in the dish just dry, lightly fried chicken with no sauce. Oh, I forgot to mention they gave me a bowl of white rice. All this for $10!! Sorry. There are plenty of good Asian restaurants out there. This one won't be on my list

MG3P3CItqDKz2sJQjud7Jg.text: This by far is the best Vietnamese Restaurant! We live in North Scottsdale and are always down to make the drive for Cyclo. We haven't had anything we didn't like!   The owner is amazing and the rest if the team is super friendly as well.  Need suggestions?... The Pho is Amazing! Want to try something different?.. Go for the Fried Rice Cakes with seafood, veggies, and beef! To start be sure to order the Vietnamese Egg Rolls, Green Beans, and Black Bean Shrimp! We always end our meal with an iced Vietnamese coffee. Better than any others. And don't forget-- it's byob!

306OgQyglNEcHmKLxFkURQ.text: Some of the best Pho I've ever had. This place is an absolute must for both locals and tourists! The owners awesome too. :)

KiPq9_iCnjIedtECzkORIg.text: This is a great place to go with friends. The decor of the place is great and the owner Justina is worth stopping in for alone. She kept it fun and energetic and did a great job explaining the made to order menu and helping us decide what to get.   As for the food I really enjoyed the Crispy Lemongrass Chicken, Spicy Green Beans, and Beef Carpaccio. The Plum Soda was interesting and a bit strange [in a good way].  I will be back for sure. This is what more restaurants should strive for. Fresh, lively, and with a high attention to detail. Having an owner running the front of house with that kind of enthusiasm for their restaurant is refreshing. I saw some other reviewers post that she may have used some salty language...f*ck yeah she did and I loved it. She read the table and was very playful and charming.   This is one of Chandler's best restaurants. It is BYOB so be alert to that.

Pv4dG1L6YhpJtk9wLfOuzA.text: Let me start by saying that I'm biased because I'm originally from the Bay Area and I know Vietnamese food...  This is not it, they're way over price and the quality of food does not make up for the poor service or the portion size.  You're looking at a $13 entree avg price, which is already high - but they don't make up for it in flavor/taste.  It took a while to get our food when two other parties got theirs before ours.  One of the pork chops on our table was really dry. Described it as eating jerky!  When looking around for the hostess to get our bill, she was sitting down eating with a friend.  Like others I've heard great things by word of mouth... But I won't be coming back here at all.  The good: It has a "wanna be trendy" little vibe to the restaurant decor. There was a diverse crowd when I was there. It's a small establishment, but clean.  I'll keep it 100... When someone chooses to not talk to you in the native language of the cuisine they're serving... That's when you need to get up out of your chair and leave. That should have been the warning sign for me.  Bottom line: Never hurts to try a new spot. But don't let me say..."I told you so"

mzUBWuyAR36LrGJ8gCXbJA.text: After reading some of the reviews about Cylco I had to come back to write my own. Cyclo was highly recommended by several colleagues and I had to try it for myself to see what the buzz is about.   First off, for all you who come from somewhere else...Like "The Bay" or "New York" or wherever you come from...? Just as a reminder you currently live in Arizona! I'm from Louisiana where there are also a lot of great Vietnamese restaurants, but who cares...I live here.   My most cherished dish here is the X.L. Beef Noodle Pho Soup. It includes braised brisket, rare sirloin, rice noodles and all the fixings so be prepared with a huge bowl if you get this to-go. If you think 12 bucks is too much for this bowl, go to some fast food franchise. The location is relatively small and intimate with ambient lighting in the evening. Additionally this is a BYOB establishment so feel free to bring your own wine or spirits...Try that at other Vietnamese restaurants!  Justine is mind-blowing and awesome in her own way! She's the owner and also works at the establishment. She's straight forward and not afraid to speak her mind so she's not for the weak hearted. When dining in, she makes her way to every table to ensure your dish suits your desire.   I hope this was informative and most importantly...Enjoy your meal.
